Information Technologies are present in diverse areas of knowledge and people's everyday lives, even when they do not realize it. People permanently use intelligent systems, connectivity services, network equipment, and data integration. Computing platforms include computers, tablets, smartphones, and many other equipment that share information and perform tasks. Students in the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems learn to analyze, design, and implement information systems. Information systems are fundamental in modern organizations. Students of the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems study artificial intelligence, new programming languages, development of apps and web systems, mobile computing, among others. Students acquire a set of tools that support companies' business processes in the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems. The Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems allows fast integration into diverse sectors of activity. Career opportunities include Information Technology Companies, Banking, Insurance, Health, Telecommunications, Logistics/Distribution, E-Business, Consulting, and Public Administration. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Consultant in Information Systems and Technologies. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Database Administrator and Programmer. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Information Systems Project Manager. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Specialist in the development of Artificial Intelligence Systems. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Specialist in the implementation of Information Systems. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Software Developer. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Systems Analyst. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include technical and managerial positions in Public Administration. Students of the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems acquire skills to analyze, design, and implement systems and information technologies. The Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems provides a link between different business areas and the area of information systems. Graduates in Information Systems know the fundamentals of information systems as tools for effective productivity increases. Graduates in Information Systems master the concepts and theories explaining methods and practices of information systems use and development in organizations. Graduates in Information Systems understand the technical aspects of computer architecture, operating systems, and connecting information resources via computer networks. Graduates in Information Systems can identify different approaches to physical design information systems using Systems Managers Database and development environments. Graduates in Information Systems can manage projects of information systems. The Information Systems degree aims to produce graduates who can conduct research, design, develop, or maintain projects in various areas of Information Systems. Graduates of the Information Systems degree demonstrate independent thinking, self-management, and effectiveness in team-oriented and open-ended activities. Graduates of the Information Systems degree develop leadership skills and perform ethically and professionally in business, industry, and society. Graduates of the Information Systems degree excel in careers related to Information Systems. The program objectives include training experts and managers to analyze, design, and implement information systems. Graduates are trained to use information systems to improve the decision-making process of organizations. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree analyze complex computing problems and apply principles of computing and other relevant disciplines to identify solutions. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree design, implement, and evaluate computing-based solutions to meet computing requirements in Information Systems. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree communicate effectively in a variety of professional contexts. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree recognize professional responsibilities and make informed judgments in computing practice based on legal and ethical principles. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree function effectively as members or leaders of teams engaged in activities appropriate to Information Systems. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree support the delivery, use, and management of information systems within an information systems environment. The main information systems environment area is Business, including Organizational Management, Finance, and Marketing. chunks_for_embedding.title: Information Systems Degree: Curriculum, Careers, and Admission Details
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk provides comprehensive information about the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems, encompassing its curriculum, structure, admission criteria, enrollment and graduation data, career opportunities, skill development, and program administration.
chunks_for_embedding.content: Information Technologies are present in diverse areas of knowledge and people's everyday lives, even when they do not realize it. People permanently use intelligent systems, connectivity services, network equipment, and data integration. Computing platforms include computers, tablets, smartphones, and many other equipment that share information and perform tasks. Students in the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems learn to analyze, design, and implement information systems. Information systems are fundamental in modern organizations. Students of the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems study artificial intelligence, new programming languages, development of apps and web systems, mobile computing, among others. Students acquire a set of tools that support companies' business processes in the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems. The Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems allows fast integration into diverse sectors of activity. Career opportunities include Information Technology Companies, Banking, Insurance, Health, Telecommunications, Logistics/Distribution, E-Business, Consulting, and Public Administration. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Consultant in Information Systems and Technologies. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Database Administrator and Programmer. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Information Systems Project Manager. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Specialist in the development of Artificial Intelligence Systems. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Specialist in the implementation of Information Systems. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Software Developer. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include Systems Analyst. Professional opportunities in Information Systems include technical and managerial positions in Public Administration. Students of the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems acquire skills to analyze, design, and implement systems and information technologies. The Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems provides a link between different business areas and the area of information systems. Graduates in Information Systems know the fundamentals of information systems as tools for effective productivity increases. Graduates in Information Systems master the concepts and theories explaining methods and practices of information systems use and development in organizations. Graduates in Information Systems understand the technical aspects of computer architecture, operating systems, and connecting information resources via computer networks. Graduates in Information Systems can identify different approaches to physical design information systems using Systems Managers Database and development environments. Graduates in Information Systems can manage projects of information systems. The Information Systems degree aims to produce graduates who can conduct research, design, develop, or maintain projects in various areas of Information Systems. Graduates of the Information Systems degree demonstrate independent thinking, self-management, and effectiveness in team-oriented and open-ended activities. Graduates of the Information Systems degree develop leadership skills and perform ethically and professionally in business, industry, and society. Graduates of the Information Systems degree excel in careers related to Information Systems. The program objectives include training experts and managers to analyze, design, and implement information systems. Graduates are trained to use information systems to improve the decision-making process of organizations. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree analyze complex computing problems and apply principles of computing and other relevant disciplines to identify solutions. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree design, implement, and evaluate computing-based solutions to meet computing requirements in Information Systems. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree communicate effectively in a variety of professional contexts. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree recognize professional responsibilities and make informed judgments in computing practice based on legal and ethical principles. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree function effectively as members or leaders of teams engaged in activities appropriate to Information Systems. Graduates of NOVA IMS Information Systems degree support the delivery, use, and management of information systems within an information systems environment. The main information systems environment area is Business, including Organizational Management, Finance, and Marketing. The curriculum of Information Systems includes courses such as Organizational Behavior. The curriculum of Information Systems includes courses such as Business Management. The curriculum of Information Systems includes courses such as Web Marketing and E-Commerce. The curriculum of Information Systems includes courses such as Information Systems Project Management. The curriculum of Information Systems includes courses such as Information Technologies, Governance, and Service Management. The curriculum of Information Systems includes courses such as Entrepreneurship and Project Analysis. The curriculum of Information Systems includes courses such as Risk Management. In 2020/2021, 177 students were enrolled in the three years of the Information Systems program. In 2021/2022, 165 students were enrolled in the three years of the Information Systems program. In 2022/2023, 182 students were enrolled in the three years of the Information Systems program. In 2020/2021, 40 students graduated from the Information Systems program. In 2021/2022, 34 students graduated from the Information Systems program. In 2022/2023, 33 students graduated from the Information Systems program. The Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems program lasts 3 years (6 semesters). Classes of the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems start in September 2025. The study plan of the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems corresponds to 180 ECTS. 150 ECTS of the Information Systems study plan correspond to mandatory curricular units (the first 5 semesters). 30 ECTS of the Information Systems study plan correspond to optional curricular units (the last semester). Optional curricular units of the last semester are chosen by each student from a wide range of available curricular units. The Establishment Code for the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems is 0906 - Universidade Nova de Lisboa - Instituto Superior de Estatística e Gestão de Informação. The Course Code for the Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems is 8259. Entry exam subjects for the Information Systems degree include Mathematics A and Economy. Entry exam subjects for the Information Systems degree include Mathematics A and Biology and Geology. Entry exam subjects for the Information Systems degree include Mathematics A and Physics and Chemistry. Entry exam subjects for the Information Systems degree include Mathematics and Portuguese. Entry exam subjects for the Information Systems degree include Mathematics and Geography. Entry exam subjects for the Information Systems degree include Mathematics and English. The minimum applicant grade for admission to the Information Systems program is 100. There are no prerequisites for the Information Systems program. There are 43 vacancies available in the Information Systems program. The Program Coordinator for the Information Systems degree is Manuela Aparício.

chunks: The European Master of Science in Information Systems Management is aimed at graduates who want to acquire additional information systems management skills for their professional field. Graduates of the program intend to receive a master's double degree diploma from two universities. The second diploma is an M.Sc. in Business Informatics from the School of Economics and Business (SEB LU) at Ljubljana University in Slovenia. Completing the master's degree program will make the student an expert in information systems technologies. Graduates can manage, advise, and participate in the development and application of information systems technologies. Graduates can manage information systems departments. Graduates can manage changes leading to the strategic renewal of businesses based on restructuring business processes and applying information technology. The European Master of Science in Information Systems Management aims to develop understanding of strategic benefits resulting from successfully implementing information systems. The program aims to develop understanding of the process of strategic planning and evaluation of business needs. The program aims to develop project management skills. The program develops appreciation of the impact and management of change caused by the introduction of information systems. The program develops the ability to manage and advise in the development and application of information resources. The program develops the ability to manage changes toward strategic renewal of business. The program lasts four semesters (120 ECTS).

One of the diplomas is an M.Sc. in Information Management, with a specialization in Information Systems Management, from NOVA Information Management School of Universidade NOVA de Lisboa in Portugal. NOVA Information Management School is ranked by Eduniversal as the best Master Program in Information Systems Management in Western Europe. The School of Economics and Business at Ljubljana University is accredited by AACBS, the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

Applications for the program are open between March 10th and April 10th, 2025. Classes during the 1st and 2nd semesters of the program will start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. Classes run after working hours, starting after 6:30 p.m., and occur 2 to 3 times a week. Applications for the program are accepted from March 10th to April 10th, 2025.
The program aims to develop capital budgeting skills.
The program enables activity, program, and project costing, control, and evaluation.
Fernando Bação is NOVA IMS' Program Coordinator. Fernando Bação holds the title of Full Professor.
Fernando Bação's email address is bacao@novaims.unl.pt.

The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS and SEB LU seeks excellent students for the program. The Admissions' Jury Panel looks for students with potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions' Jury Panel values qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English in both spoken and written forms. To apply, applicants need to access NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants must fill in a form in the user area detailing personal, academic, and professional background. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae. Uploading the Curriculum Vitae is the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants may include other documents they find relevant to enrich their application, such as a certificate of completion for a Bachelor's or Master's degree. Applicants admitted to the program must submit their Bachelor's or Master's degree completion certificate or a certificate of attendance within one month. Applicants must choose the program on the application portal. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program, limited to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay an application fee to complete their application. After submission of the application, the applicant will receive an email confirming their application. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. Members of the Admissions' Jury Panel may decide to hold an interview with applicants. Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or through videoconference. The application fee for the program is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the program's tuition fee and non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for applicants from European Union member countries is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for applicants of other nationalities is €2,500 unless their registration fee is provided by an official entity. Upon registration in the 1st and 2nd years, students must pay a €35 enrollment fee at NOVA IMS. The enrollment fee amount is updated annually. Students must pay an annual school insurance fee of €1.40 at NOVA IMS.

The school insurance fee amount is updated annually. Students must also pay enrollment and school insurance fees at SEB LU. The tuition fee for the program is €8,000. Students must pay tuition directly to each university within the specified payment deadlines.

Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program, limited to 1,000 characters including spaces.
Applicants must pay an application fee to complete their application.
After submission of the application, the applicant will receive an email confirming their application.
The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum.
Members of the Admissions' Jury Panel may decide to hold an interview with applicants.
Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or through videoconference.
The application fee for the program is €51.
The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission.
Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment.
The pre-registration fee is deductible from the program's tuition fee and non-refundable in case of withdrawal.
The pre-registration fee for applicants from European Union member countries is €1,250.
The pre-registration fee for applicants of other nationalities is €2,500 unless their registration fee is provided by an official entity.
Upon registration in the 1st and 2nd years, students must pay a €35 enrollment fee at NOVA IMS.
The enrollment fee amount is updated annually.
Students must pay an annual school insurance fee of €1.40 at NOVA IMS.

chunks: The Master Degree Program in Clinical Research Management is developed in partnership with NOVA IMS, NOVA Medical School (NMS|FCM), National School of Public Health (ENSP-NOVA), and Universidade de Aveiro (UA). The Master Degree Program in Clinical Research Management aims to train highly qualified human resources to enable clinical research in health care facilities, universities, academic centers, biobanks, pharmaceutical and healthcare technology companies, and clinical research organizations. The training and professionalization of structures and teams that support clinical research improve the quality of research teams. The training and professionalization of structures and teams that support clinical research increase the performance and competitiveness of research teams. MEGIC focuses its strategy on improving the quality, performance, and competitiveness of research teams. The program includes an internship in a real working environment. The internship aims to allow the development of competencies defined for the study cycle. The 7th edition (2024/2025) of the Master Degree Program in Clinical Research Management will be held in Lisbon at Faculdade Ciências Médicas | Nova Medical School. The program lasts for 4 semesters. The classes for the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd semesters of the program will start in September 2022. The classes for the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd semesters of the program will run on Thursdays and Fridays (9 a.m. to 6:30 p.m.). The 5th edition (2022/2023) of the Master Degree Program in Clinical Research Management will be held in Lisbon at Faculdade Ciências Médicas | Nova Medical School.

The written contents of the 7th edition (2024/2025) will be available in the English language. The interaction with the students in the 7th edition (2024/2025) will be conducted in the Portuguese language.
Pedro Simões Coelho is the Program Coordinator for NOVA IMS. Pedro Simões Coelho holds the title of Full Professor. Pedro Simões Coelho can be contacted via email: psc@novaims.unl.pt.

The Admissions' Jury Panel is looking for excellent students who have the potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions' Jury Panel is looking for qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in the academic path and in a professional career. The selection process is based on the analysis of the academic, scientific, and professional curriculum of the candidate. An interview may be conducted as a complementary criterion for selection. A written test may be conducted as a complementary criterion for selection. Applicants must register and fill out the form on www.nms.unl.pt under Education > Masters > Master in Clinical Research Management > Application guide > Link 'Efetuar registo'. The application fee is €51. The application can only be considered after payment of the application fee. The application fee must be paid within the stipulated period.
The tuition fee for Portuguese students is €2.750 per year. The tuition fee for international students is €5.500 per year.

chunks: The Master Degree Program is called Master Degree in Data-Driven Marketing. The Master Degree in Data-Driven Marketing includes a specialization in Data Science for Marketing. The Master Degree Program in Data-Driven Marketing aims to fill a gap in the postgraduate training of marketing professionals. Marketing professionals in the program need to gain new skills to actively participate in the development of analytical marketing models. Marketing professionals in the program need to gain new skills to actively participate in the application of analytical marketing models. The study plan of the program presents an up-to-date structure. The structure of the program combines several areas of marketing with a transversal approach of data science. The program leverages the combination of marketing areas with data science. The program is designed to provide excellent training to students. The program articulates key concepts and challenges for marketing decision-making. The program addresses strategic strands for marketing decision-making. The program addresses innovation strands for marketing decision-making. The program addresses methodological strands for marketing decision-making. The program includes practical data-oriented processing in the study plan. Practical data-oriented processing includes Data Science. Practical data-oriented processing includes Big Data. The program includes Artificial Intelligence in the study plan. The program includes social network analysis in the study plan. The program includes consumer behavior analysis in the study plan. The program offers versatility in optional curricular units. Related areas include digital marketing. Related areas include social media. The first year of the Master Degree corresponds to the Postgraduate Program in Data Science for Marketing.
Artificial Intelligence includes Generative AI. Artificial Intelligence includes Machine Learning.
Optional curricular units reinforce theoretical knowledge in related areas. Optional curricular units reinforce practical knowledge in related areas.
Related areas include e-commerce. Related areas include search engine optimization.
Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025.

chunks: The Master Degree in Data-Driven Marketing specializes in Marketing Research and CRM. The Master Degree Program in Data-Driven Marketing fills a gap in the high-level training of managers, technical staff, and other experts in marketing. The Master Degree Program is targeted at technical staff and market researchers. The Master Degree Program is targeted at professionals involved in customer relationship management. The main goal of the Master Degree Program is to provide excellent and balanced training with a conceptual component and marketing methodology with quantitative aptitude. The main goal of the Master Degree Program includes providing practical training that draws on case studies and project development. The first year of the Master Degree corresponds to the Postgraduate Program in Marketing Research and CRM. Applications for the Master Degree Program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Applicants can apply to the Master Degree Program by clicking the relevant link. The Master Degree Program aims to plan, create, and conduct market studies. The Master Degree Program aims to conduct other types of market research. The Master Degree Program aims to select and apply methods for the collection of marketing data. The Master Degree Program aims to analyze, interpret, and communicate the results of market research. The Master Degree Program aims to manage, explore, interpret, and communicate marketing information from information systems. The Master Degree Program aims to manage, explore, interpret, and communicate marketing information from other sources. The Master Degree Program aims to create, implement, and manage customer relationship policies. The Program Coordinator is Paulo Rita. The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students who can become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions' Jury Panel looks for students with maturity, determination, and motivation in their academic and professional career. Applications for the Master Program are open from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. Applicants must hold a bachelor’s degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English, both spoken and written. Applicants must access NOVA IMS' Applications Portal to apply. Applicants need to fill out the form available within NOVA IMS' user area as part of the application. Applicants need to provide information about their personal, academic, and professional background in the form. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants can upload other documents to enrich their application, such as certificates of completion of their Bachelor's or Master's degrees. If admitted, applicants must submit their Bachelor's or Master's degree completion certificate within one month. Applicants who have not completed their degrees must submit a certificate of attendance. Applicants must choose the program during the application process. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying, limited to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay a €51 application fee. Applications are considered only after payment of the €51 application fee. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may hold interviews with applicants, either face-to-face or via videoconference. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for European Union nationals is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for non-European Union nationals is €2,500 unless covered by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay an enrollment fee of €35, which is updated annually. Upon registration, students must pay annual school insurance of €1,40, which is updated annually. The tuition fee for European Union nationals is €6,000. The tuition fee for European Union nationals includes €4,100 for the 1st year and €1,900 for the 2nd year. The tuition fee for non-European Union nationals is €7,500. The tuition fee for non-European Union nationals includes €4,900 for the 1st year and €2,600 for the 2nd year. Tuition fees can be paid in two installments or six installments. Payment in two installments requires the full tuition fee of the 1st year to be paid from September 25th to 30th, 2025. Payment in two installments requires the full tuition fee of the 2nd year to be paid from September 25th to 30th, 2026. Payment in six installments requires 25% of the 1st year tuition fee to be paid from September 25th to 30th, 2025. Payment in six installments requires 25% of the 1st year tuition fee to be paid from November 25th to 30th, 2025. Payment in six installments requires 25% of the 1st year tuition fee to be paid from February 22nd to 28th, 2026. Payment in six installments requires 25% of the 1st year tuition fee to be paid from April 25th to 30th, 2026. Payment in six installments requires 50% of the 2nd year tuition fee to be paid from September 25th to 30th, 2026. Payment in six installments requires 50% of the 2nd year tuition fee to be paid from February 22nd to 28th, 2027. Students who pay tuition fees in two installments receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni receive a 20% discount on tuition fees, which can be combined with the financial discount. Companies financing the program for two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The discount for financing two employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The discount for financing three employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The 15% tuition fee discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants upon presentation of valid documentation. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul should contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt for more information. The 15% discount is not cumulative with other discounts or financial offers.
Paulo Rita holds the title of Full Professor. Paulo Rita's email address is prita@novaims.unl.pt.

The Master Degree Program aims to manage, explore, interpret, and communicate marketing information from information systems. The Master Degree Program aims to manage, explore, interpret, and communicate marketing information from other sources. The Master Degree Program aims to create, implement, and manage customer relationship policies. The Program Coordinator is Paulo Rita. The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students who can become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions' Jury Panel looks for students with maturity, determination, and motivation in their academic and professional career. Applications for the Master Program are open from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. Applicants must hold a bachelor’s degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English, both spoken and written. Applicants must access NOVA IMS' Applications Portal to apply. Applicants need to fill out the form available within NOVA IMS' user area as part of the application. Applicants need to provide information about their personal, academic, and professional background in the form. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants can upload other documents to enrich their application, such as certificates of completion of their Bachelor's or Master's degrees. If admitted, applicants must submit their Bachelor's or Master's degree completion certificate within one month. Applicants who have not completed their degrees must submit a certificate of attendance. Applicants must choose the program during the application process. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying, limited to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay a €51 application fee. Applications are considered only after payment of the €51 application fee. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may hold interviews with applicants, either face-to-face or via videoconference. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for European Union nationals is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for non-European Union nationals is €2,500 unless covered by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay an enrollment fee of €35, which is updated annually. Upon registration, students must pay annual school insurance of €1,40, which is updated annually. The tuition fee for European Union nationals is €6,000. The tuition fee for European Union nationals includes €4,100 for the 1st year and €1,900 for the 2nd year. The tuition fee for non-European Union nationals is €7,500. The tuition fee for non-European Union nationals includes €4,900 for the 1st year and €2,600 for the 2nd year. Tuition fees can be paid in two installments or six installments. Payment in two installments requires the full tuition fee of the 1st year to be paid from September 25th to 30th, 2025. Payment in two installments requires the full tuition fee of the 2nd year to be paid from September 25th to 30th, 2026. Payment in six installments requires 25% of the 1st year tuition fee to be paid from September 25th to 30th, 2025. Payment in six installments requires 25% of the 1st year tuition fee to be paid from November 25th to 30th, 2025. Payment in six installments requires 25% of the 1st year tuition fee to be paid from February 22nd to 28th, 2026. Payment in six installments requires 25% of the 1st year tuition fee to be paid from April 25th to 30th, 2026. Payment in six installments requires 50% of the 2nd year tuition fee to be paid from September 25th to 30th, 2026. Payment in six installments requires 50% of the 2nd year tuition fee to be paid from February 22nd to 28th, 2027. Students who pay tuition fees in two installments receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni receive a 20% discount on tuition fees, which can be combined with the financial discount. Companies financing the program for two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The discount for financing two employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The discount for financing three employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The 15% tuition fee discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants upon presentation of valid documentation. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul should contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt for more information. The 15% discount is not cumulative with other discounts or financial offers.

chunks: The Master degree Program in Data Science and Advanced Analytics specializes in Business Analytics. The Master degree Program is aimed at market-oriented people. The program focuses on applying effective analytical models to different business problems. The program focuses on interpreting analytical model results and their implications for business. The objective of the program is to enable data-driven decisions to optimize the business process. This Master program is ranked as the best in Data Analytics in Western Europe by Eduniversal for the 2nd time in a row. A new application phase for NOVA IMS' postgraduate and master's programs is open from May 19th to June 18th. Vacancies for the Business Analytics specialization have already been filled. The program includes an understanding of the main paradigms associated with large databases and data warehouses. The program includes an understanding of the processes of decision-making. The program includes mastery of data mining tools, especially for problems related to Big Data. The program includes mastery of the processes of creating and maintaining descriptive and predictive models. The program includes recognizing and applying effective analytical models to various business cases. The program includes interpreting models and their implications for business. The Master degree program lasts 4 semesters. Classes for the program start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. Classes run 2 to 3 times a week during working hours. The application phase runs from February 6th to March 7th, 2025. Applicants must hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a compatible field by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English, spoken and written.

In every academic year, partners offer a paid internship to 1st-year students. The paid internship is undertaken during the 2nd year of the program. 1st-year students must apply for the internships they are interested in. Internships are assigned to the students with the best qualifications in the application process.
Eduniversal publishes an annual ranking of the best MBA and Master degree programs worldwide.

chunks: The Master Degree Program in Data Science and Advanced Analytics specializes in Data Science. The program is aimed at technically oriented people with a solid scientific background. Participants in the program will apply their skills to solve complex real-world problems involving vast amounts of data. Each academic year, paid internships are offered to 1st-year students by the program’s partners. These internships are conducted during the 2nd year of the program. The Master Degree Program has been ranked as the top Master program in Data Analytics in Western Europe by Eduniversal. A new application phase for NOVA IMS' postgraduate and master's programs is open from May 19th to June 18th. Vacancies for the Data Science specialization in this program are already filled. One goal of the program is understanding the main paradigms associated with large databases and data warehouses. The program aims for participants to master data mining tools and computational intelligence, especially for Big Data-related problems. Participants will learn to create and maintain descriptive and predictive models. Participants will master problem-solving concepts.

The program is designed for individuals who want to strengthen and deepen their skills in commonly used paradigms and environments for software development. Participants will master commonly used paradigms and environments for software development.
1st-year students must apply for the internships they are interested in. Internships are assigned based on the qualifications of the applicants during the application process.
Eduniversal is an international agency that publishes annual rankings of MBA and Master degree programs. The program received this ranking for the second consecutive year.

Remaining programs with available positions can be checked online. Applications are submitted through NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants need to fill out the form in the portal's user area, providing personal, academic, and professional information. Applicants need to upload their Curriculum Vitae, which is the only mandatory document for application. Other relevant documents, such as completion certificates for Bachelor's or Master's degrees, can optionally be attached. Admitted applicants will need to submit a degree completion certificate or, if applicable, a certificate of attendance for pending degrees, within one month of admission. Applicants must select their program when applying. Applicants must present their goals and motivations for applying in an entry limited to 1,000 characters. Applicants receive a confirmation email after submitting their application. The selection process is based on an analysis of the academic and professional curriculum. Members of the Admissions’ Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with some or all applicants. Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference.
Another goal of the program is understanding decision-making processes.
The Program Coordinator is named Roberto Henriques. Roberto Henriques is an Associate Professor.
Roberto Henriques' email address is roberto@novaims.unl.pt.
The program lasts 4 semesters.

Classes start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. Classes are held during working hours 2 to 3 times per week. The application phase runs from March 10th to April 10th, 2025. 50% of the 2nd year’s tuition fee is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026.

The application fee for the program is €51. The application fee is non-refundable if an applicant withdraws or is not admitted. An application will only be considered after the application fee has been paid within the stipulated period. The tuition fee for applicants with European Union nationality is €6,200. The tuition fee for European Union applicants is split into €4,100 for the 1st year and €2,100 for the 2nd year. The tuition fee for applicants of other nationalities is €8,000. The tuition fee for non-European Union applicants is split into €5,300 for the 1st year and €2,700 for the 2nd year. Applicants must pay the application fee to finalize their application. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee around one week after admission result announcements. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee of the program. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for European Union applicants is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for non-European Union applicants is €2,500 unless financed by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay an enrollment fee of €35 (value updated annually). Students must pay €1.40 annually for school insurance (value updated annually). The registration fee for the 2nd year and subsequent years is €35 (value updated annually). Tuition fees can be paid either in two installments or six installments. Payment in two installments involves paying 100% of the 1st year’s tuition fee between September 25th and 30th, 2025. The payment of 100% of the 2nd year’s tuition fee is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026. Payment in six installments involves paying 25% of the 1st year’s tuition fee between September 25th and 30th, 2025. Another 25% of the 1st year’s tuition fee is due between November 25th and 30th, 2025. Another 25% of the 1st year’s tuition fee is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. The final 25% of the 1st year’s tuition fee is due between April 25th and 30th, 2026. The final 50% of the 2nd year’s tuition fee is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2027. Students who choose two installments receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni receive a 20% tuition fee discount, which is cumulative with the financial discount. Companies financing two employees in the program during the same academic year receive a 10% tuition fee discount. Companies financing three or more employees in the program during the same academic year receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The discount for companies financing multiple employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% tuition fee discount. The 15% discount for Ordem dos Engenheiros can be extended to members' spouses and descendants with valid documentation. For details on Ordem dos Engenheiros discounts, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. Ordem dos Engenheiros discounts are not cumulative with other financial discounts.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Advanced Data Science & Analytics Training
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains information about advanced educational programs in Data Science and Analytics, emphasizing specialized training, scientific foundations, practical applications, program rankings, internship opportunities, admission timelines, and skill development in predictive modeling, data mining, and Big Data tools.
chunks_for_embedding.content: The Master Degree Program in Data Science and Advanced Analytics specializes in Data Science. The program is aimed at technically oriented people with a solid scientific background. Participants in the program will apply their skills to solve complex real-world problems involving vast amounts of data. Each academic year, paid internships are offered to 1st-year students by the program’s partners. These internships are conducted during the 2nd year of the program. The Master Degree Program has been ranked as the top Master program in Data Analytics in Western Europe by Eduniversal. A new application phase for NOVA IMS' postgraduate and master's programs is open from May 19th to June 18th. Vacancies for the Data Science specialization in this program are already filled. One goal of the program is understanding the main paradigms associated with large databases and data warehouses. The program aims for participants to master data mining tools and computational intelligence, especially for Big Data-related problems. Participants will learn to create and maintain descriptive and predictive models. Participants will master problem-solving concepts.

chunks: The program is a Master's Degree in Geographic Information Systems and Science. The program has a specialization in Geographic Information Systems and Science. The specialization provides a technical and scientific framework related to the use of geographic information technology and analysis. The specialization emphasizes skills related to the modeling and analysis of spatial data. The specialization focuses on the design and planning of geographic information technology and analysis in organizations. The program is developed in collaboration with UNIGIS, an international network. The program has obtained the GEOINT accreditation by the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF). The program was the first outside the US to be accredited by the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF). The program is taught in b-learning and e-learning formats. The program lasts 4 semesters. Two semesters of the program correspond to the curricular component. Two semesters of the program are dedicated to the development of a thesis, work project, or internship report. The program has a total of 120 ECTS. The classes of the first and second semesters will start in September 2025. The classes of the first and second semesters will end in June 2026. The first year of the Master's degree corresponds to the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science. Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The program aims to develop appropriate strategies, methodologies, and tools for geographic information management. The program aims to model, monitor, and simulate geographic, demographic, and environmental phenomena in diverse analysis contexts. The program aims to use exploration and analysis methodologies and tools to reduce levels of uncertainty in addressing problems of a geographical nature. The program aims to design and develop information systems and technologies that meet the needs of geographic information within an organizational context. The program coordinator is Marco Painho. Applications for the program are open from May 19th to June 18th, 2025.
UNIGIS brings together the best schools in Geographic Information Systems and Science. The program aims to analyze questions raised when using geographic information.
Marco Painho is a Full Professor. Marco Painho's email is painho@novaims.unl.pt.

NOVA IMS is looking for excellent students who have the potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The required qualities include maturity, determination, and motivation in both academic and professional careers. Applicants should hold a relevant bachelor's degree or equivalent in Statistics and Information Management, Geography, Economics, Engineering, Computer Sciences, Physics, Mathematics, Architecture, Urban and Regional Planning, or other relevant scientific fields. Applications from those holding higher education conferred in the 1st cycle under the Bologna legislation by European countries are accepted. Applications from those holding a foreign academic degree approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS are accepted. Applications from those holding a relevant academic, professional, or scientific curriculum approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS are accepted. To apply, applicants need to access the NOVA IMS Applications Portal. Applicants must fill in the form available in the user area. Applicants must provide personal, academic, and professional background information. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae, which is mandatory for the application. Applicants may include additional documents they consider relevant, such as certificates of completion of Bachelor's or Master's degrees. If admitted, applicants must submit their Bachelor's and/or Master's degree completion certificates or certificates of attendance within one month. Applicants must choose the program they are applying for. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program in a statement of up to 1,000 characters, including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee. After completing the application process, applicants will receive an email confirming their application submission. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions Jury Panel may decide to hold an interview with applicants. Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. The application fee for the program is €51. Applications are only considered after payment of the application fee. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. After admission and confirmation of enrollment, applicants must make a pre-registration payment within approximately one week. The pre-registration payment is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration payment is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for applicants with EU nationality is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for applicants of other nationalities is €2,500 unless provided by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay €35 for the enrollment fee. Upon registration, students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance. The enrollment fee value is updated annually. The registration fee for the second year and subsequent years is €35. The tuition fee for the Master's degree program is €4,200. €3,000 of the tuition fee corresponds to the curricular component (first year). €1,200 of the tuition fee corresponds to the development of a thesis or work project. The tuition fee can be paid in two installments or four installments. For payment in two installments, the first payment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025, covering 100% of the tuition fee for the first year. For payment in two installments, the second payment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026, covering 100% of the tuition fee for the second year. For payment in four installments, the first payment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025, covering 50% of the tuition fee for the first year. For payment in four installments, the second payment is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026, covering 50% of the tuition fee for the first year. For payment in four installments, the third payment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026, covering 50% of the tuition fee for the second year. For payment in four installments, the fourth payment is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2027, covering 50% of the tuition fee for the second year. Students who choose to pay the tuition fee in two installments receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni who have completed a bachelor's, postgraduate, master's, or doctoral degree at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount. Companies that finance the program for two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The 10% company discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies that finance the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The 20% company discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants upon presentation of valid documentation. For more information on the Ordem dos Engenheiros discount, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts.
The school insurance value is updated annually.

For payment in four installments, the third payment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026, covering 50% of the tuition fee for the second year. For payment in four installments, the fourth payment is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2027, covering 50% of the tuition fee for the second year. Students who choose to pay the tuition fee in two installments receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni who have completed a bachelor's, postgraduate, master's, or doctoral degree at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount. Companies that finance the program for two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The 10% company discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies that finance the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The 20% company discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants upon presentation of valid documentation. For more information on the Ordem dos Engenheiros discount, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts.

propositions: NOVA IMS is looking for excellent students who have the potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers.
The required qualities include maturity, determination, and motivation in both academic and professional careers.

Applicants should hold a relevant bachelor's degree or equivalent in Statistics and Information Management, Geography, Economics, Engineering, Computer Sciences, Physics, Mathematics, Architecture, Urban and Regional Planning, or other relevant scientific fields.
Applications from those holding higher education conferred in the 1st cycle under the Bologna legislation by European countries are accepted.
Applications from those holding a foreign academic degree approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS are accepted.
Applications from those holding a relevant academic, professional, or scientific curriculum approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS are accepted.
To apply, applicants need to access the NOVA IMS Applications Portal.
Applicants must fill in the form available in the user area.
Applicants must provide personal, academic, and professional background information.
Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae, which is mandatory for the application.
Applicants may include additional documents they consider relevant, such as certificates of completion of Bachelor's or Master's degrees.
If admitted, applicants must submit their Bachelor's and/or Master's degree completion certificates or certificates of attendance within one month.
Applicants must choose the program they are applying for.
Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program in a statement of up to 1,000 characters, including spaces.
Applicants must pay the application fee.
After completing the application process, applicants will receive an email confirming their application submission.
The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum.
The Admissions Jury Panel may decide to hold an interview with applicants.
Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference.
The application fee for the program is €51.
Applications are only considered after payment of the application fee.
The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program.
After admission and confirmation of enrollment, applicants must make a pre-registration payment within approximately one week.
The pre-registration payment is deductible from the tuition fee.
The pre-registration payment is non-refundable in case of withdrawal.
The pre-registration fee for applicants with EU nationality is €1,250.
The pre-registration fee for applicants of other nationalities is €2,500 unless provided by an official entity.
Upon registration, students must pay €35 for the enrollment fee.
Upon registration, students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance.
The enrollment fee value is updated annually.
The registration fee for the second year and subsequent years is €35.
The tuition fee for the Master's degree program is €4,200.
€3,000 of the tuition fee corresponds to the curricular component (first year).
€1,200 of the tuition fee corresponds to the development of a thesis or work project.
The tuition fee can be paid in two installments or four installments.
For payment in two installments, the first payment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025, covering 100% of the tuition fee for the first year.
For payment in two installments, the second payment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026, covering 100% of the tuition fee for the second year.
For payment in four installments, the first payment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025, covering 50% of the tuition fee for the first year.
For payment in four installments, the second payment is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026, covering 50% of the tuition fee for the first year.
For payment in four installments, the third payment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026, covering 50% of the tuition fee for the second year.
For payment in four installments, the fourth payment is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2027, covering 50% of the tuition fee for the second year.
Students who choose to pay the tuition fee in two installments receive a 2.5% financial discount.
NOVA IMS alumni who have completed a bachelor's, postgraduate, master's, or doctoral degree at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on tuition fees.
The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount.
Companies that finance the program for two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% discount on tuition fees.
The 10% company discount is not cumulative with other discounts.
Companies that finance the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% discount on tuition fees.
The 20% company discount is not cumulative with other discounts.
Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees.
The Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants upon presentation of valid documentation.
For more information on the Ordem dos Engenheiros discount, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt.
The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts.

chunks: A Master's Degree is offered in Geographic Information Systems and Science. The Master's Degree program has a specialization in Geospatial Data Science. The specialization in Geospatial Data Science provides skills for the analysis, modeling, and visualization of geographic information. The specialization in Geospatial Data Science trains professionals for roles involving artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining. The specialization in Geospatial Data Science focuses on the development of solutions to societal challenges in public and private sectors. The Master's program is developed in collaboration with UNIGIS. UNIGIS is an international network that brings together the best schools in Geographic Information Systems and Science. The Master's program has obtained GEOINT accreditation from the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF). The Master's program was the first program outside the United States to be accredited by USGIF. The Master's program is taught in b-learning or e-learning formats. The Master's program lasts for four semesters. Two semesters of the Master's program correspond to the curricular component. Two semesters of the Master's program correspond to the development of a thesis, work project, or internship report. The Master's program has a total of 120 ECTS. The first and second semesters of the Master's program will start in September 2025. The first and second semesters of the Master's program will end in June 2026. The first year of the Master's program corresponds to a Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science. Applications for the Master's program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The program aims to help students understand and contribute to technical and social challenges created by geospatial data environments. The program aims to teach the architecture, integrity, and management of geospatial data. The program aims to teach how geospatial data can be acquired and used for analysis, modeling, and geovisualization in large data environments. The program aims to teach the use of artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining to enhance concepts and workflows in geographic information science. The program aims to provide institution-centric solutions to societal problems in public and private sectors. Marco Painho is the Program Coordinator for the Master's program. Applicants to the Master's program must hold a relevant bachelor's degree or equivalent.
Marco Painho holds the title of Full Professor. Marco Painho's email address is painho@novaims.unl.pt.

The Master Degree in Information Management focuses on digital transformation in business. The program recognizes the significance of digital transformation in today's business world. The program aims to strengthen NOVA IMS's training offering in digital transformation. The program focuses on technological advancements and processes to help organizations enhance their competitive advantage. The program explores technological advancements to transform or develop organizational business models. Digital transformation is increasingly crucial for companies to remain relevant and competitive. Professionals participating in the program will gain understanding and competences to leverage technology for business growth. Professionals in the program will learn how to create new opportunities through technology. The program equips professionals with skills and knowledge to stay ahead in a fast-paced digital environment. The program teaches professionals to work effectively with new technologies. The Postgraduate Program in Digital Transformation helps individuals and organizations navigate the digital world. The program focuses on technological developments and processes to drive business success and enhancement. The first year of the Master corresponds to the Postgraduate Program in Digital Transformation. The program trains technicians and managers capable of formulating and evaluating digital transformation processes in organizations. The program presents solutions to increase productivity and efficiency in organizations. Efficient and secure data management is included in the program's solutions.
Training in digital transformation is of significant importance. The training focuses on adopting best practices and continuously improving skills.

The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants from European Union member countries. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants of other nationalities unless covered by an official entity. Students must pay an enrollment fee of €35 (value updated annually) upon registration. Students must pay an annual school insurance fee of €1.40 (value updated annually) upon registration. The tuition fee of this master degree program is €6,000 for applicants from European Union member countries. The tuition fee for European Union applicants is split as €4,100 for the first year and €1,900 for the second year. The tuition fee of this master degree program is €7,500 for applicants of other nationalities. The tuition fee for non-European Union applicants is split as €4,900 for the first year and €2,600 for the second year. The tuition fee can be paid in two or in six installments. The first payment in the two-installment plan is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025 (100% of first-year tuition). The second payment in the two-installment plan is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026 (100% of second-year tuition). The first payment in the six-installment plan is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025 (25% of first-year tuition). The second payment in the six-installment plan is due between November 25th and 30th, 2025 (25% of first-year tuition). The third payment in the six-installment plan is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026 (25% of first-year tuition). The fourth payment in the six-installment plan is due between April 25th and 30th, 2026 (25% of first-year tuition). The fifth payment in the six-installment plan is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026 (50% of second-year tuition). The sixth payment in the six-installment plan is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2027 (50% of second-year tuition). Students paying tuition in two installments receive a 2.5% discount on the payable amount. NOVA IMS alumni receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The alumni discount can be combined with the financial discount. Companies financing the program for two employees receive a 10% tuition discount. The company discount for two employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees receive a 20% tuition discount. The company discount for three or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount extends to members' spouses and descendants upon valid documentation.

Fernando Bação is a Full Professor.

The program lasts three semesters. Classes start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. Classes run after 6:30 p.m. Classes are held 2 to 3 times a week.

NOVA IMS seeks excellent students for its Admissions' Jury Panel. The Admissions' Jury Panel evaluates students for their potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions Panel values maturity, determination, and motivation in applicants. Applicants must hold a bachelor’s degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English in both spoken and written forms. Admitted applicants must submit Bachelor's or Master’s degree completion certificates within one month of admission. The selection process includes the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions' Jury Panel may conduct interviews with some applicants. Interviews can be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Digital Transformation & Business Advancement
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains information about a Master's program in Information Management specializing in Digital Transformation, which emphasizes leveraging technology, enhancing organizational processes, and equipping professionals with skills to navigate and succeed in a rapidly evolving digital landscape.
chunks_for_embedding.content: The program is a Master Degree in Information Management with a specialization in Digital Transformation. The Master Degree in Information Management focuses on digital transformation in business. The program recognizes the significance of digital transformation in today's business world. The program aims to strengthen NOVA IMS's training offering in digital transformation. The program focuses on technological advancements and processes to help organizations enhance their competitive advantage. The program explores technological advancements to transform or develop organizational business models. Digital transformation is increasingly crucial for companies to remain relevant and competitive. Professionals participating in the program will gain understanding and competences to leverage technology for business growth. Professionals in the program will learn how to create new opportunities through technology. The program equips professionals with skills and knowledge to stay ahead in a fast-paced digital environment. The program teaches professionals to work effectively with new technologies. The Postgraduate Program in Digital Transformation helps individuals and organizations navigate the digital world. The program focuses on technological developments and processes to drive business success and enhancement. The first year of the Master corresponds to the Postgraduate Program in Digital Transformation. The program trains technicians and managers capable of formulating and evaluating digital transformation processes in organizations. The program presents solutions to increase productivity and efficiency in organizations. Efficient and secure data management is included in the program's solutions.

chunks: The Master Degree in Law and Financial Markets is offered in partnership by NOVA Information Management School and NOVA School of Law. The Master Degree in Law and Financial Markets is fully taught in English. The Master Degree in Law and Financial Markets is consistently ranked by Eduniversal among the top master's courses in Western Europe. The Master Degree in Law and Financial Markets provides expert training in international financial markets to law graduates and graduates from other fields. The Master Degree in Law and Financial Markets aims to facilitate graduates’ entry into the legal profession in banking, insurance, or capital markets. The Master Degree in Law and Financial Markets prepares graduates for law practice at top law firms in corporate or financial departments. The Master Degree in Law and Financial Markets equips graduates to provide consultancy or auditing services. The Master Degree in Law and Financial Markets enables graduates to pursue careers in regulation and supervision of financial markets. The program has a strong European and international focus. The program is designed to prepare students to face global challenges of the next generation of lawyers and policymakers. The program includes an innovative set of courses in law and finance. Students of the program have opportunities to meet and network with leading financial institutions. Students gain hands-on experience through internships in financial institutions. Students may benefit from international experiences at top universities in Europe or beyond. NOVA School of Law is a member of Themis Network. Applications for the program are open between April 23rd and May 7th, 2025. The program aims to deepen the basic legal knowledge acquired during a bachelor’s degree. The program focuses on legal fields closely linked to financial markets and investments. The program helps students understand the organization and functioning of the general financial system. The program trains students in the organization and functioning of financial markets. The program provides analysis and evaluation skills for financial instruments traded on capital markets. The program equips students to identify intervention strategies in capital markets using financial instruments. Intervention strategies include risk hedging, arbitrage, and speculation. The program stimulates a critical and interdisciplinary approach to knowledge. The program provides lawyers with tools to solve complex problems or issue judgments on situations of incomplete information. Regulation No. 362/2016 outlines the Master Program in Law and Financial Markets and is published in the Official Gazette, 2nd series, No. 68, April 7th, 2016. Regulation No. 8581/2020 outlines changes to the study plan and is published in the Official Gazette, Series 2, No. 174, September 7th, 2020.

Fernando Bação is the Program Coordinator at NOVA IMS. Fernando Bação’s title is Full Professor. Fernando Bação’s email address is bacao@novaims.unl.pt. Pedro Simões Coelho’s email address is psc@novaims.unl.pt.
Pedro Simões Coelho is the Program Coordinator at NOVA IMS. Pedro Simões Coelho’s title is Full Professor.

The program lasts four semesters. The program corresponds to 120 ECTS. Classes for the first and second semesters start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. Classes run after working hours (after 6 p.m.). Classes are held at NOVA School of Law or NOVA IMS in Campus de Campolide, in Lisbon.

The tuition fee for international students from the European Union is €6,200. The tuition fee for the curricular component of the program (1st year) for EU students is €4,200. The tuition fee for the thesis, work project, or internship with a report (2nd year) for EU students is €2,000. The tuition fee for international students from outside the European Union is €10,000. The tuition fee for the curricular component of the program (1st year) for non-EU students is €7,000. The tuition fee for the thesis, work project, or internship with a report (2nd year) for non-EU students is €3,000.

Merit scholarships are awarded to students with a final average admission equal to or higher than 17 points (on a scale of 0/20). Students with an average admission of 17 or higher benefit from a 50% tuition fee reduction for the taught component. Merit scholarships are awarded to students with a final average admission equal to or higher than 16 points (on a scale of 0/20). Students with an average admission of 16 or higher benefit from a 30% tuition fee reduction for the taught component. In the non-taught phase, academic merit awards are given. The best student of the taught component who continues and attends the non-taught phase benefits from 100% tuition fee reduction for the non-taught phase. The second-best student benefits from a 60% tuition fee reduction for the non-taught phase. The third-best student benefits from a 60% tuition fee reduction for the non-taught phase. The program is eligible for the NOVA IMS Social Mobility Scholarship. SASNOVA awards scholarships and emergency aid to economically disadvantaged students at NOVA University Lisbon. DGES scholarships are available for 1st and 2nd cycle students at NOVA University Lisbon. Scholarships for Access to Study Cycles are available for students of all three study cycles at NOVA University Lisbon. Scholarships for Access to Study Cycles are available for nationals, stateless persons, and foreigners with tax residence in Portugal or refugee status. Scholarships for Access to Study Cycles aim to support students in financial need who do not benefit from DGES scholarships.

The Cycle of Studies Self-Assessment Report is available in Portuguese. The External Review Team Final Report (CAE) is available in Portuguese. The Decision of the A3ES Board of Directors is available in Portuguese. The A3ES Deliberation is part of the program accreditations.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Scholarships & Financial Aid Programs
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains information about scholarships and financial aid programs, including merit-based tuition fee reductions, academic performance awards, social mobility scholarships, emergency aid, and support for students across all study cycles, financial circumstances, and backgrounds at NOVA University Lisbon.
chunks_for_embedding.content: Merit scholarships are awarded to students with a final average admission equal to or higher than 17 points (on a scale of 0/20). Students with an average admission of 17 or higher benefit from a 50% tuition fee reduction for the taught component. Merit scholarships are awarded to students with a final average admission equal to or higher than 16 points (on a scale of 0/20). Students with an average admission of 16 or higher benefit from a 30% tuition fee reduction for the taught component. In the non-taught phase, academic merit awards are given. The best student of the taught component who continues and attends the non-taught phase benefits from 100% tuition fee reduction for the non-taught phase. The second-best student benefits from a 60% tuition fee reduction for the non-taught phase. The third-best student benefits from a 60% tuition fee reduction for the non-taught phase. The program is eligible for the NOVA IMS Social Mobility Scholarship. SASNOVA awards scholarships and emergency aid to economically disadvantaged students at NOVA University Lisbon. DGES scholarships are available for 1st and 2nd cycle students at NOVA University Lisbon. Scholarships for Access to Study Cycles are available for students of all three study cycles at NOVA University Lisbon. Scholarships for Access to Study Cycles are available for nationals, stateless persons, and foreigners with tax residence in Portugal or refugee status. Scholarships for Access to Study Cycles aim to support students in financial need who do not benefit from DGES scholarships.
