chunks: The Master's Degree Program in Risk Management prepares professionals and executives to address challenges of identifying, assessing, and managing risk in the financial sector. The program aligns with international standards such as those set by the CFA Institute and GARP. The program covers essential knowledge needed for informed decision-making. The program aligns with best practices and regulatory requirements such as Basel III/IV and Solvency II. The program has a current and innovative curriculum. The program takes a hands-on, practice-oriented approach. The program is supported by a strong analytical foundation. The program integrates cutting-edge techniques in machine learning, deep learning, and artificial intelligence. The program explores the transformation of the financial industry driven by technologies like blockchain and AI. The program covers FinTech, InsurTech, RegTech, Decentralized Finance, and Crypto-assets. The program evolved from the Risk Analysis and Management specialization. The Risk Analysis and Management specialization was part of the Master’s in Statistics and Information Management. The Master’s in Statistics and Information Management was classified as the best Master's Degree in Risk Management in Portugal by Eduniversal. The Master’s in Statistics and Information Management was classified as the 2nd best Master's Degree in Risk Management in the world by Eduniversal. Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The program aims to familiarize students with operations and products in the activity of financial institutions. The program aims to help students identify and quantify risks associated with financial institutions. The program aims to teach students how to manage various current risks in institutions. The program aims to help students make decisions based on economic value quantifying techniques. The program aims to teach students how to manage European solvency systems for banking and insurance in a balanced way. Jorge Miguel Bravo is the Program Coordinator for the Master's Degree Program in Risk Management. The program lasts 3 semesters. The program’s classes start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. The program’s classes run after working hours (after 6:30 p.m.), 2 to 3 times a week. Applications for the program are accepted from May 19th to June 18th, 2025.
Eduniversal is an international agency that publishes the annual ranking of the best Master's Degrees and MBAs in the world.
Jorge Miguel Bravo holds the title of Associate Professor.
Jorge Miguel Bravo’s email address is jbravo@novaims.unl.pt.

The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS is looking for excellent students. The Admissions' Jury Panel is seeking students with the potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions' Jury Panel values qualities like maturity, determination, and motivation in the academic path and professional career. Applicants must hold a bachelor’s degree in a compatible field (completed by September 2025). Applicants must be proficient in English (spoken and written). To apply, applicants need to access the NOVA IMS Applications Portal. Applicants must fill in the form in the portal, including personal, academic, and professional background details. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae, which is the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants may upload other relevant documents to enrich their application, such as completion certificates for bachelor’s or master’s degrees. If admitted, applicants must submit completion certificates or attendance certificates for bachelor’s or master’s degrees within one month. Applicants must choose the program during the application process. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program (limit 1,000 characters including spaces). Applicants must pay the application fee to complete the application process. Once the application is submitted, applicants will receive an email confirmation. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with applicants. Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. The application fee is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. After admission, applicants must pay a pre-registration fee. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee of the master program. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants from European Union member countries. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants from other countries unless covered by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay an enrollment fee of €35 (updated annually). Students must pay an annual school insurance fee of €1.40 (updated annually). The tuition fee is €6,000 for applicants from European Union member countries. The tuition fee is €7,500 for applicants from other countries. The tuition fee for European Union member country applicants is €4,100 for the 1st year and €1,900 for the 2nd year. The tuition fee for other nationality applicants is €4,900 for the 1st year and €2,600 for the 2nd year. The tuition fee can be paid in two installments. For payment in two installments, 1st installment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025. For payment in two installments, 2nd installment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026. The tuition fee can be paid in six installments. For payment in six installments, the 1st installment (25% of tuition fee for the 1st year) is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025. For payment in six installments, the 2nd installment (25% of tuition fee for the 1st year) is due between November 25th and 30th, 2025. For payment in six installments, the 3rd installment (25% of tuition fee for the 1st year) is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. For payment in six installments, the 4th installment (25% of tuition fee for the 1st year) is due between April 25th and 30th, 2026. For payment in six installments, the 5th installment (50% of tuition fee for the 2nd year) is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026. For payment in six installments, the 6th installment (50% of tuition fee for the 2nd year) is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2027.

chunks: The program is a Master's Degree in Statistics and Information Management, with a specialization in Data Analytics. The Master's Degree Program aims to train experts and managers qualified to lead and guide information collection, compilation, analysis, and management inside organizations. Experts and managers with skills in information collection and analysis are scarce in today's data-driven landscape. The Data Analytics specialization equips students with the latest tools and techniques. The program merges classic statistical rigor with cutting-edge information management approaches. The first year of the Master's corresponds to the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics. The program has the goal to develop techniques and methodologies for data collection. The program has the goal to apply methodologies, tools, and computational statistics to explore and analyze information.

Organizations crave professionals who can transform raw data into actionable insights. The specialization prepares students to analyze consumer trends. The specialization prepares students to optimize business decision-making. The specialization prepares students to predict market fluctuations. Graduates from the program are positioned as strategic leaders capable of driving innovation and growth. Analyzing information aims to reduce levels of uncertainty associated with decision-making processes.
Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Application phase for the program runs from May 19th to June 18th, 2025.
The program has the goal to communicate results in written form or orally. Communication of results adapts content to the level and interests of the audience.
The Program Coordinator is Bruno Damásio.
Bruno Damásio holds the title of Assistant Professor.
The email address of Bruno Damásio is bdamasio@novaims.unl.pt. For questions about the program, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt.

The program lasts 3 semesters. Classes for the program will start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. Classes for the program run after working hours, starting after 6:30 p.m. Classes are scheduled 2 to 3 times a week.

The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field to enter the program. Applicants must have completed their bachelor's degree by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English (spoken and written). To apply, applicants need to access the NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants must fill out a form in the user area with personal, academic, and professional background information. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as a mandatory document for the application. Applicants have the option to include additional documents relevant to their application. If admitted, applicants must submit a certificate of completion of their degree or a certificate of attendance within one month. Applicants must choose the program during the application process. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying, limited to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee to complete the submission process. The application fee is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in cases of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee but is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants of other nationalities unless provided by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay an enrollment fee of €35.

The Jury Panel looks for students with potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Jury Panel seeks qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in applicants. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. Members of the Admissions’ Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with some or all applicants. Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference.
Upon completion of application steps, applicants receive an email confirming their submission.

The enrollment fee is updated annually. Students must pay an annual school insurance fee of €1.40. The annual school insurance fee is updated annually. The tuition fee for EU applicants is €6,000. The tuition fee for EU applicants includes €4,100 for the first year and €1,900 for the second year. The tuition fee for non-EU applicants is €7,500. The tuition fee for non-EU applicants includes €4,900 for the first year and €2,600 for the second year. Tuition fees can be paid in two or six installments. In two installments, the first payment covers 100% of the first-year tuition fee and is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025. In two installments, the second payment covers 100% of the second-year tuition fee and is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026. In six installments, the first payment covers 25% of the first-year tuition fee and is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025. In six installments, the second payment covers 25% of the first-year tuition fee and is due between November 25th and 30th, 2025. In six installments, the third payment covers 25% of the first-year tuition fee and is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. In six installments, the fourth payment covers 25% of the first-year tuition fee and is due between April 25th and 30th, 2026. In six installments, the fifth payment covers 50% of the second-year tuition fee and is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026. In six installments, the sixth payment covers 50% of the second-year tuition fee and is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2027. Students who opt for two-installment payments receive a 2.5% discount on the tuition fee. NOVA IMS alumni who completed degrees at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount for two-installment payments. Companies that finance tuition for 2 employees in the same year receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The 10% discount for companies is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies that finance tuition for 3 or more employees in the same year receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The 20% discount for companies is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The 15% discount for Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul can extend to members' spouses and descendants. Proof of valid documentation is required for the 15% discount for Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul members.

The Data Analytics specialization equips students with the latest tools and techniques. The program merges classic statistical rigor with cutting-edge information management approaches. The program has the goal to apply methodologies, tools, and computational statistics to explore and analyze information.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Admission Requirements & Procedures
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains detailed information about the admission requirements, application procedures, necessary documentation, fee structures, and other conditions for enrolling in academic programs at NOVA IMS.
chunks_for_embedding.content: The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field to enter the program. Applicants must have completed their bachelor's degree by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English (spoken and written). To apply, applicants need to access the NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants must fill out a form in the user area with personal, academic, and professional background information. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as a mandatory document for the application. Applicants have the option to include additional documents relevant to their application. If admitted, applicants must submit a certificate of completion of their degree or a certificate of attendance within one month. Applicants must choose the program during the application process. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying, limited to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee to complete the submission process. The application fee is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in cases of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee but is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants of other nationalities unless provided by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay an enrollment fee of €35.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Tuition Fees, Payment Plans & Discounts
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains comprehensive information about financial requirements and benefits for students, including tuition and insurance fees, payment plans and schedules, discounts for various groups, and necessary conditions for discounts.
chunks_for_embedding.content: The enrollment fee is updated annually. Students must pay an annual school insurance fee of €1.40. The annual school insurance fee is updated annually. The tuition fee for EU applicants is €6,000. The tuition fee for EU applicants includes €4,100 for the first year and €1,900 for the second year. The tuition fee for non-EU applicants is €7,500. The tuition fee for non-EU applicants includes €4,900 for the first year and €2,600 for the second year. Tuition fees can be paid in two or six installments. In two installments, the first payment covers 100% of the first-year tuition fee and is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025. In two installments, the second payment covers 100% of the second-year tuition fee and is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026. In six installments, the first payment covers 25% of the first-year tuition fee and is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025. In six installments, the second payment covers 25% of the first-year tuition fee and is due between November 25th and 30th, 2025. In six installments, the third payment covers 25% of the first-year tuition fee and is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. In six installments, the fourth payment covers 25% of the first-year tuition fee and is due between April 25th and 30th, 2026. In six installments, the fifth payment covers 50% of the second-year tuition fee and is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026. In six installments, the sixth payment covers 50% of the second-year tuition fee and is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2027. Students who opt for two-installment payments receive a 2.5% discount on the tuition fee. NOVA IMS alumni who completed degrees at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount for two-installment payments. Companies that finance tuition for 2 employees in the same year receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The 10% discount for companies is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies that finance tuition for 3 or more employees in the same year receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The 20% discount for companies is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The 15% discount for Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul can extend to members' spouses and descendants. Proof of valid documentation is required for the 15% discount for Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul members.

chunks: The Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies (Erasmus Mundus Program) is a cooperation between NOVA IMS in Portugal, the Institute for Geoinformatics (IFGI) of the University of Münster (WWU) in Germany, and the Universitat Jaume I (UJI) in Spain. The Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies is aimed at graduates who wish to obtain qualifications in fields where geographic information is applied. The Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies is aimed at graduates who intend to have a multicultural experience. The Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies has been selected by the Erasmus Mundus Program of the European Commission as one of the most excellent Master Programs in Europe. The Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies is aimed at qualified undergraduates in fields where Geographic Information (GI) is applied. Examples of fields where Geographic Information (GI) is applied include environmental planning, regional planning, geography, logistics, transportation, defense, marketing, energy provision, and computer science. Applications for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. To apply for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program, applicants can click a specified link. Goals of the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program include applying data modeling skills. Goals of the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program include understanding the basics of geographic information. Goals of the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program include acting based on knowledge of information technology, new media, and fundamental concepts of geoinformatics. Goals of the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program include resorting to skills in geoinformatics, including basic and advanced modules. Goals of the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program include managing programs and research methods. The Program Coordinator for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program is Marco Painho. The Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program lasts from September 2025 to July 2026. Classes for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program will be held 2 to 3 times a week. The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS is looking for excellent students with potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions' Jury Panel values qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in the academic path. The Admissions' Jury Panel values qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in the professional career. The application phase for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program runs from May 19th until June 18th, 2025. Admission requirements for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program include holding a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025. Admission requirements for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program include providing proof of English language proficiency with TOEFL 500 paper-based or equivalent. Admission requirements for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program include demonstrating strong motivation. Admission requirements for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program include showing high-level achievements in previous academic and professional careers. The application process for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program involves filling the form available in NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. The application process for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program requires submitting a Curriculum Vitae. The application process for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program requires submitting a motivation letter. The selection process for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program is based on analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The selection process for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program includes an interview with the applicant. The Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program has a special agreement regarding the application fee. Applicants can be exempt from the €51 application fee for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program by choosing 'voucher' in the payment method and submitting the code 'NOVAIMS_GEOTECH'. The application for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program will only be considered successfully submitted after the submission of the voucher. The tuition fee for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program is €1,700 per semester. After confirmation of enrollment, admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program. The pre-registration fee for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for applicants of other nationalities is €2,500, unless their registration fee is provided by an official entity. The pre-registration fee for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program is deductible in the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. Upon registration, students must pay a €35 enrollment fee for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program (updated annually). Upon registration, students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program (updated annually). The registration fee for the 2nd year and the following years of the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program is €35 (updated annually). The tuition fee for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program can be paid in two or three installments. If paid in two installments, the tuition fee payment dates are from September 25th to 30th, 2025 (100% for 1st year) and September 25th to 30th, 2026 (100% for 2nd year). If paid in three installments, the tuition fee payment dates are from September 25th to 30th, 2025 (50% for 1st year), February 22nd to 28th, 2026 (50% for 1st year), and September 25th to 30th, 2026 (100% for 2nd year). Students who choose to pay the tuition fee in two installments receive a 2.5% discount. The numerus clausus for the Master's of Science in Geospatial Technologies program starting at NOVA IMS is 16 students.
Marco Painho holds the title of Full Professor. Marco Painho's email is painho@novaims.unl.pt.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Enterprise Data Science & Analytics is developed in partnership with Microsoft. The Postgraduate Program in Enterprise Data Science & Analytics presents methodologies and tools for transforming data into information. This program aims to qualify professionals in the use of big data methodologies. This program aims to qualify professionals in the use of machine learning methodologies and tools. Applications for the Postgraduate Program in Enterprise Data Science & Analytics are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Classes for this program will start in February 2026 and end in December 2026. Classes will run after working hours, starting at 6:30 p.m. Classes will take place 2 to 3 times per week. The program coordinator Roberto Henriques is an Associate Professor. The program coordinator Henrique Carreiro is an Invited Assistant Professor. The program has a duration of 2 semesters. Goals of the program include exploration and transformation of data. Goals of the program include creation of data models and data visualization. Goals of the program include application of statistical methods to data. Goals of the program include application of data science methodologies. Goals of the program include implementation and validation of machine learning models. Goals of the program include application of data science techniques to enterprise environments.

Enterprises can base strategic decisions on information transformed from data. Strategic decisions include entering new markets, launching new product or service lines, optimizing processes, transforming business models, and competing in a data-driven market.
Roberto Henriques' email is roberto@novaims.unl.pt. Henrique Carreiro's email is hcarreiro@novaims.unl.pt.

The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students for the program. The Admissions' Jury Panel is looking for qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in academic and professional paths. To enter the program, applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by January 2026. Applicants to the program must be proficient in English, both spoken and written. The selection process for the program involves analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with applicants, either face-to-face or via videoconference. To apply, applicants must access the NOVA IMS’ Applications Portal. Applicants must fill out a form with personal, academic, and professional information. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants have the option of submitting other relevant documents to enrich their application. Applicants admitted to the program must provide their bachelor's or master's degree completion certificate within one month after admission. Applicants must choose the program they are applying for. Applicants must present goals and motivation for applying in a statement with a limit of 1,000 characters, including spaces. Applicants must pay an application fee to complete their application. The application fee for the program is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission into the program. The tuition fee for European Union applicants is €5,100. The tuition fee for non-European Union applicants is €6,100. Applications submitted by June 18th receive a €100 discount on the tuition fee. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments. Full tuition payment is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. The first installment payment is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. The second installment payment is due between April 25th and 30th, 2026. The third installment payment is due between September 25th and 30th, 2026. The fourth installment payment is due between November 25th and 30th, 2026. Students admitted to the program must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for European Union applicants is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for non-European Union applicants is €2,500 unless provided by an official entity. The enrollment fee is €35 and updated annually. Students paying the tuition fee in a single payment receive a 2.5% discount on the amount. Additional information about the Ordem dos Engenheiros discount can be requested via admissions@novaims.unl.pt.

The annual school insurance fee is €1.40 and updated annually. NOVA IMS alumni receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. Alumni discounts can be combined with the single-payment financial discount. Companies financing the program for at least two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The 10% company discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The 20% company discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Participants from Microsoft receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The Microsoft participant discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants upon valid documentation. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other discounts.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Artificial Intelligence for Business Transformation equips managers and professionals to lead digital transformation. The Postgraduate Program in Artificial Intelligence for Business Transformation enables mastery of artificial intelligence, machine learning, big data & analytics, IoT, and other disruptive technologies. The Postgraduate Program prepares leaders to effectively align technology with strategy. The Postgraduate Program takes a practical and strategic approach to digital transformation. The Postgraduate Program in Artificial Intelligence for Business Transformation evolved from the former Postgraduate Program in Digital Enterprise Management. The updated version of the program features an advanced curriculum tailored to the demands of today’s market. The program prepares professionals for challenges in the digital era. Some modules in the postgraduate course are equivalent to curricular units in the Master's in Information Management with a specialization in Digital Transformation. Students who complete the postgraduate course can obtain recognized academic credits for possible integration into the Master's in Information Management program. Applying advanced methodologies is a goal of the program. Consolidating acquired knowledge through a final capstone project is a goal of the program.

Innovation redefines competitiveness in the current business landscape. The program focuses on developing new business models. The program focuses on optimizing business processes. Eduniversal recognizes the program as one of the top programs in Western Europe for Innovation and Project Management.

The program focuses on strengthening organizational strategy. Leading business transformation processes aligned with organizational strategy is a goal of the program. Driving change in processes, structure, and human resources is a goal of the program. Selecting and implementing the most suitable technological solutions to maximize organizational profitability and productivity is a goal of the program. Exploring industry best practices is a goal of the program. Applying artificial intelligence and emerging technologies in real-world business transformation scenarios is a goal of the program.

Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The program lasts 2 semesters. Classes for the program will start in February 2026 and end in December 2026. Classes will run after working hours, starting after 6:30 p.m., 2 to 3 times a week. Applications for the program are open from May 19th to June 18th, 2025.
Jorge Carrola Rodrigues is an Invited Assistant Professor and a Program Coordinator.

Jorge Carrola Rodrigues can be contacted via email at jcarrola@novaims.unl.pt. Pedro Ruivo can be contacted via email at pruivo@novaims.unl.pt. Tiago Oliveira can be contacted via email at toliveira@novaims.unl.pt.
Pedro Ruivo is an Invited Assistant Professor and a Program Coordinator.
Tiago Oliveira is a Full Professor and a Program Coordinator.

The Admissions' Jury Panel at NOVA IMS seeks excellent students with potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. Maturity, determination, and motivation in the academic and professional path are qualities sought by the Admissions' Jury Panel. Applicants must meet the requirement of holding a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by January 2026 to enter the program. Applicants must be proficient in English, both spoken and written, to enter the program. To apply, applicants must access NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants must fill in the form available in the user area, including personal, academic, and professional background. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae, which is the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants may attach additional documents to enrich their application, such as a certificate of completion of their Bachelor's or Master's degree. Admitted applicants must submit their Bachelor's or Master's degree completion certificate, or a certificate of attendance if the degree is not yet completed, within one month. Applicants must choose the program while applying. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program within a limit of 1,000 characters, including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee to complete their application. Applicants will receive a confirmation email upon submitting their application. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with all or some applicants. Interviews can be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. The application fee for the program is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. Applicants admitted to the program must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the postgraduate program's tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for applicants from EU member countries is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for applicants of other nationalities is €2,500, unless provided by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay a €35 enrollment fee. The enrollment fee value is updated annually. Students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance upon registration. The tuition fee for applicants from EU member countries is €4,100. The tuition fee for applicants of other nationalities is €4,900. Applications submitted by June 18th receive a €100 discount on the tuition fee. Students who pay the tuition fee in a single payment receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni who have completed a degree at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on the tuition fee. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount. Companies financing the program for at least two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% discount. The company discount for two employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% discount. The company discount for three or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Participants from client or partner institutions indicated by Google, SAP, and IDC receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The Google, SAP, and IDC partner institution discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants upon presentation of valid documentation. For more information on the Ordem dos Engenheiros discount, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts. The tuition fee can be paid in full between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The tuition fee can be paid in four installments: 25% of the fee between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The second installment for tuition payment (25%) is due between April 25th and April 30th, 2026. The third installment for tuition payment (25%) is due between September 25th and September 30th, 2026. The fourth installment for tuition payment (25%) is due between November 25th and November 30th, 2026.
The school insurance value is updated annually.

Companies financing the program for at least two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% discount. The company discount for two employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% discount. The company discount for three or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Participants from client or partner institutions indicated by Google, SAP, and IDC receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The Google, SAP, and IDC partner institution discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants upon presentation of valid documentation. For more information on the Ordem dos Engenheiros discount, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts. The tuition fee can be paid in full between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The tuition fee can be paid in four installments: 25% of the fee between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The second installment for tuition payment (25%) is due between April 25th and April 30th, 2026. The third installment for tuition payment (25%) is due between September 25th and September 30th, 2026. The fourth installment for tuition payment (25%) is due between November 25th and November 30th, 2026.

chunks: Businesses operate in a globalizing and ever-changing environment. The ability to leverage data and digital transformation is a critical success factor for businesses. The Postgraduate Program in Business Intelligence aims to train experts and managers. The program trains individuals to design, build, and use business intelligence and analytics processes. Business intelligence and analytics processes support organizational decision making. Business intelligence and analytics processes support knowledge management. Business intelligence and analytics processes induce value creation. Business intelligence and analytics processes promote operational and strategic excellence. This program is aimed at managers seeking added value from data warehouses. This program is aimed at technical staff working on business intelligence initiatives. Business intelligence initiatives include data warehousing. Business intelligence initiatives include business analytics. Business intelligence initiatives include data visualization. The Postgraduate Program provides access to the Master Degree Program in Information Management. The Master Degree Program in Information Management specializes in Business Intelligence. The Master Degree Program in Information Management is ranked as the best in Business Intelligence and Strategy in the world by Eduniversal. The Postgraduate Program aims to develop an understanding of Business Intelligence processes. The program involves using analytical applications to monitor organizational performance. The program involves using visualization tools. The program involves understanding the purpose of Data Mining and Predictive Analytics. The program meets the main techniques of Data Mining and Predictive Analytics.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Business Intelligence and Analytics for Hospitality & Tourism responds to the need for higher education in the tourism industry. The program aims to prepare professionals capable of developing and applying analytical models for tourism and hospitality. The program combines various areas involved with a transversal data science approach to leverage them. The TIA - Tourism International Academy Project (TIA | PRR) will provide 15 scholarships for postgraduate students of the edition starting in February 2025. Each scholarship will be worth €2,000. To receive the scholarship, students must reside in Portugal during the course. To receive the scholarship, students must successfully complete Data Science for Hospitality and Tourism I. To receive the scholarship, students must successfully complete Business Intelligence in Turismo. The Postgraduate Program aims to equip professionals with Business Intelligence and Business Analytics competences applied to the hospitality and tourism sector. The Postgraduate Program aims to deepen analytical and problem-solving skills within the hospitality and tourism industry. The Postgraduate Program aims to update management and marketing knowledge in the context of digital transformation. The Postgraduate Program aims to address challenges posed by the big data era to tourism organizations and companies. The Postgraduate Program aims to develop hospitality and tourism analytics projects integrating concepts and tools worked throughout the program. In the 2024-25 edition of the program, 15 scholarships worth €2,000 each will be available. To receive a scholarship, students must settle tuition fees due by July 2025. The TIA | PRR Project scholarship cannot be combined with other discounts.
Tourism is fundamental to the development of the world economy.
The program will be held in person. The program provides the option of participating online in real time.

Applications for the program are open until February 16th, 2025. The Postgraduate Program lasts 2 semesters. Classes for the program will start in February 2025. Classes for the program will end in December 2025. Classes for the program will run after working hours (after 6:30 p.m.), 2 to 3 times a week. The entry requirements for the program include holding a bachelor's degree in a compatible field, completed by January 2025. The entry requirements for the program include proficiency in spoken and written English. Applications must be submitted through NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants must fill out the form available in the user area with personal, academic, and professional background. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae, which is the only mandatory document for application. Applicants have the option to include additional relevant documents such as certificates of completion of degrees. If admitted, applicants must submit their Bachelor’s and/or Master's degree completion certificate within one month.

Applicants must choose the program they are applying to. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program (maximum 1,000 characters, including spaces). Applicants must pay the application fee to complete their application. The application fee for the program is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. The selection process is based on analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with applicants, either face-to-face or through videoconference. Applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for applicants from EU and Portuguese-speaking countries is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for applicants from other countries is €2,500 unless provided by an official entity. Students must pay €35 for enrollment fees upon registration.

Students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance upon registration. The tuition fee for the postgraduate program is €4,100. Students who choose to pay the tuition fee in full will receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni who completed a degree at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The alumni discount is cumulative with the 2.5% financial discount. Companies financing the program for 2 employees in the same academic year receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. Companies financing the program for 3 or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. Discounts for companies financing multiple employees are not cumulative with other discounts. Special conditions are available for employees and associates of the program’s partners. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The discount for Ordem dos Engenheiros members extends to their spouses and descendants upon valid documentation. Ordem dos Engenheiros membership discounts are not cumulative with financial discounts. The tuition fee can be paid in full from February 22–28, 2025. The tuition fee can be paid in four installments. The first installment (25% of the tuition fee) is due from February 22–28, 2025. The second installment (25% of the tuition fee) is due from April 25–30, 2025. The third installment (25% of the tuition fee) is due from June 25–30, 2025. The fourth installment (25% of the tuition fee) is due from September 25–30, 2025.

Ordem dos Engenheiros membership discounts are not cumulative with financial discounts. The tuition fee can be paid in full from February 22–28, 2025. The tuition fee can be paid in four installments. The first installment (25% of the tuition fee) is due from February 22–28, 2025. The second installment (25% of the tuition fee) is due from April 25–30, 2025. The third installment (25% of the tuition fee) is due from June 25–30, 2025. The fourth installment (25% of the tuition fee) is due from September 25–30, 2025.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics aims to train experts and managers qualified to lead and guide information collection, compilation, analysis, and management inside organizations. Experts and managers with skills in information collection, compilation, analysis, and management are highly scarce in today's data-driven landscape. Organizations crave professionals who can navigate the vast seas of information and transform raw data into actionable insights. The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics goes beyond traditional statistics, equipping students with the latest tools and techniques to thrive in the digital age. Graduates from the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics can analyze consumer trends. Graduates from the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics can optimize business decision-making. Graduates from the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics can predict market fluctuations. Graduates from the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics will emerge as strategic leaders capable of driving innovation and growth. The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics merges classic statistical rigor with cutting-edge information management approaches. The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics gets access to the Master Degree Program in Statistics and Information Management, with a specialization in Data Analytics. The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics develops techniques and methodologies for data collection. The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics applies various methodologies, tools, and computational statistics to explore and analyze information. The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics reduces levels of uncertainty associated with decision-making through data analysis. The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics emphasizes communicating results in written form or orally. The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics emphasizes adapting communication to the level and interests of the audience. Bruno Damásio is the Program Coordinator for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics. The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics lasts 2 semesters. The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS is looking for excellent students for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics. The Admissions' Jury Panel evaluates students who have the potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers.

The applications for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics starts in September 2025 and ends in June 2026. Classes for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics run after working hours (after 6:30 p.m.), 2 to 3 times a week. The application phase for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics is from May 19th to June 18th, 2025.
Bruno Damásio is an Assistant Professor. Bruno Damásio's email is bdamasio@novaims.unl.pt.

The Admissions' Jury Panel looks for qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in applicants. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field (completed by September 2025) to enter the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics. Applicants must be proficient in English (spoken and written) to enter the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics. To apply for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics, applicants must access NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants must fill in the form available in the user area, providing personal, academic, and professional background information. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as a mandatory document for the application. Applicants may include other relevant documents to enrich their application, such as certificates of completion of their Bachelor's and/or Master's degree. If admitted, applicants must submit their Bachelor's and/or Master's degree completion certificate or certificate of attendance within one month. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program, limited to 1,000 characters (including spaces). Applicants must pay the application fee to complete the application process. After paying the application fee, applicants will receive an email confirming their submitted application. The selection process for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with all or some applicants. Interviews may be held face-to-face or via videoconference. The application fee for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program.
Applicants must choose the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics in the application process.

The application fee must be paid within the stipulated period. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants with a nationality from a European Union member country. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants of other nationalities unless provided by an official entity. Students must pay €35 for the enrollment fee, updated annually. Students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance, updated annually. The tuition fee for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics is €4,200 for applicants with a nationality from a European Union member country. The tuition fee for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics is €4,900 for applicants of other nationalities. The tuition fee for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics can be paid in full or in four installments. Full tuition payment for the Postgraduate Program in Data Analytics must be made between September 25th and September 30th, 2025. The first installment of tuition fee payment (25%) must be made between September 25th and September 30th, 2025. The second installment of tuition fee payment (25%) must be made between November 25th and November 30th, 2025. The third installment of tuition fee payment (25%) must be made between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The fourth installment of tuition fee payment (25%) must be made between April 25th and April 30th, 2026.

chunks: The Postgraduate Diploma in Data Science for Finance is an internationally innovative training program. The program offers a quantitative and analytical approach to finance. The program is aimed at professionals in the financial sector seeking a more analytical approach to finance. The program focuses on the valuation of financial assets. The program focuses on trading. The program focuses on risk management. The program focuses on financial engineering. The program focuses on predictive models. The program focuses on financial computing. The program includes other related areas beyond those explicitly mentioned. The program provides an understanding of the potential transformations in the financial industry resulting from blockchain technology adoption. Blockchain technology adoption is relevant to FinTech and InsurTech. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in investment banking. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in asset management. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in hedge funds. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in investment advisory. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in risk management. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in sales and trading. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in hedge funds (additional mention). The program prepares senior management for successful careers in financial engineering. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in financial technology. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in consulting or advisory roles. This Postgraduate Program gives access to the Master Degree Program in Risk Management. Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Developing data-driven pricing and risk management models of plain vanilla financial securities is a program goal. Developing data-driven pricing and risk management models of exotic financial securities is a program goal. The program's models compete with traditional model-based approaches. Developing data-driven models that explain the dynamics of financial asset prices is a program goal. Implementing and validating data models in finance is a program goal. Machine learning methods are implemented and validated in finance as part of the program. Deep learning methods are implemented and validated in finance as part of the program. Understanding the transformations in the financial industry resulting from blockchain adoption is a program goal. Blockchain adoption is relevant to FinTech and InsurTech industries. Acquiring and developing skills in R, a popular programming language in the financial industry, is a program goal. Acquiring and developing skills in Python, a popular programming language in the financial industry, is a program goal. Developing predictive analysis and trading models is a program goal. Developing sentiment analysis techniques is a program goal. Developing financial fraud detection techniques is a program goal. Developing credit rating models is a program goal. Developing insurance pricing models is a program goal. Developing customer segmentation methods is a program goal. Jorge Miguel Bravo is the program coordinator. The Postgraduate Program lasts four trimesters. The classes for this program start in September 2025. The classes for this program end in June 2026. Classes run after working hours (after 6:30 p.m.) 2 to 3 times a week. Applications are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Postgraduate Program in Data Science, Finance & Technology Applications
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk provides comprehensive details about a postgraduate program in data science and finance, highlighting its emphasis on quantitative finance, machine learning, programming skills, predictive modeling, blockchain applications, career pathways, program structure, and enrollment periods.
chunks_for_embedding.content: The Postgraduate Diploma in Data Science for Finance is an internationally innovative training program. The program offers a quantitative and analytical approach to finance. The program is aimed at professionals in the financial sector seeking a more analytical approach to finance. The program focuses on the valuation of financial assets. The program focuses on trading. The program focuses on risk management. The program focuses on financial engineering. The program focuses on predictive models. The program focuses on financial computing. The program includes other related areas beyond those explicitly mentioned. The program provides an understanding of the potential transformations in the financial industry resulting from blockchain technology adoption. Blockchain technology adoption is relevant to FinTech and InsurTech. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in investment banking. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in asset management. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in hedge funds. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in investment advisory. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in risk management. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in sales and trading. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in hedge funds (additional mention). The program prepares senior management for successful careers in financial engineering. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in financial technology. The program prepares senior management for successful careers in consulting or advisory roles. This Postgraduate Program gives access to the Master Degree Program in Risk Management. Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Developing data-driven pricing and risk management models of plain vanilla financial securities is a program goal. Developing data-driven pricing and risk management models of exotic financial securities is a program goal. The program's models compete with traditional model-based approaches. Developing data-driven models that explain the dynamics of financial asset prices is a program goal. Implementing and validating data models in finance is a program goal. Machine learning methods are implemented and validated in finance as part of the program. Deep learning methods are implemented and validated in finance as part of the program. Understanding the transformations in the financial industry resulting from blockchain adoption is a program goal. Blockchain adoption is relevant to FinTech and InsurTech industries. Acquiring and developing skills in R, a popular programming language in the financial industry, is a program goal. Acquiring and developing skills in Python, a popular programming language in the financial industry, is a program goal. Developing predictive analysis and trading models is a program goal. Developing sentiment analysis techniques is a program goal. Developing financial fraud detection techniques is a program goal. Developing credit rating models is a program goal. Developing insurance pricing models is a program goal. Developing customer segmentation methods is a program goal. Jorge Miguel Bravo is the program coordinator. The Postgraduate Program lasts four trimesters. The classes for this program start in September 2025. The classes for this program end in June 2026. Classes run after working hours (after 6:30 p.m.) 2 to 3 times a week. Applications are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Application Process & Payment Policies
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains comprehensive details about NOVA IMS program application requirements, payment policies, tuition fees, discount eligibility, and related procedures, including deadlines and documentation.
chunks_for_embedding.content: Applications must be submitted using NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants need to complete the form in the user area with personal, academic, and professional background details. Applicants need to upload their Curriculum Vitae, which is a mandatory document. Applicants can optionally upload other documents to enrich their application. Applicants must submit their bachelor's or master's degree completion certificate within one month if admitted. Applicants can submit a certificate of attendance if their degree is not yet completed. Applicants must choose the program they are applying for. Applicants must present their goals and motivations for applying to the program. Applicants must limit their motivation statement to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee. Applicants will receive an email confirming their submitted application after completing the process. The application fee is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission. After admission and enrollment confirmation, a pre-registration fee must be paid. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for EU nationals. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants of other nationalities. Applicants supported by an official entity may have their registration fee provided. Students must make a payment of €35 for the enrollment fee upon registration. The enrollment fee is updated annually. The tuition fee for EU nationals is €5,100. The tuition fee for non-EU nationals is €6,100. Tuition fees include all handouts and teaching materials used in class. Tuition fees include coffee breaks on class days. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments. The tuition fee full payment must be made between September 25th and 30th, 2025. The first installment (25%) must be paid between September 25th and 30th, 2025. The second installment (25%) must be paid between November 25th and 30th, 2025. The third installment (25%) must be paid between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. The fourth installment (25%) must be paid between April 25th and 30th, 2026. Students who pay the tuition fee in a single payment receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount for single payment. Companies financing the program for 2 employees receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The discount for companies financing 2 employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for 3 or more employees receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The discount for companies financing 3 or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% tuition fee discount. The 15% discount extends to members’ spouses upon presentation of valid documentation. The 15% discount extends to members’ descendants upon presentation of valid documentation. For more information about the 15% discount, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The 15% discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts.

chunks: The Postgraduate program in Data Science for Marketing aims to fill a gap in the postgraduate training of marketing professionals. Marketing professionals need to gain new skills to actively participate in the development and application of analytical marketing models. The study plan of the Postgraduate program in Data Science for Marketing presents an up-to-date structure. The program combines areas of marketing with a transversal approach of data science. The transversal approach of data science in the program aims to leverage areas of marketing. This program is designed to provide excellent training in marketing and data science. The program articulates key concepts and challenges for marketing decision-making. The program covers multiple strategic, innovation, and methodological strands of marketing decision-making. The program includes practical data-oriented processing in Data Science and Big Data. The program includes Artificial Intelligence topics, such as Generative AI and Machine Learning. The program includes topics on social network analysis and consumer behavior. The program includes elective course units in digital marketing, social media, e-commerce, and search engine optimization. Elective course units in the program reinforce theoretical knowledge in digital marketing, social media, e-commerce, and search engine optimization. Elective course units in the program reinforce practical knowledge in digital marketing, social media, e-commerce, and search engine optimization. Graduates of the Postgraduate program in Data Science for Marketing have access to the Master Degree Program in Data-Driven Marketing. The Master Degree Program in Data-Driven Marketing has a specialization in Data Science for Marketing. Applications for the Postgraduate program in Data Science for Marketing are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Bridging the gap between marketing and data science is a goal of the program. The program empowers students with the ability to think critically about data. The program teaches students how to derive conclusions from incomplete information. Supporting marketing decision-making through practical understanding of methods used by data scientists is a goal of the program. The program teaches students data science tools and models. The program prepares students to deploy data science tools and models in organizations. The program develops the capability to load, clean, and transform data. The program teaches students to identify the best models and methodologies for extracting marketing knowledge from data. The program addresses heterogeneous and complex data sources. Understanding the power of Big Data is a goal of the program. The program teaches students to process large streams of data in real-time to achieve business solutions. The program teaches students to interpret and communicate data and results. The program provides real-world marketing examples for interpreting and communicating data and results. The program prepares students to face the challenges of the modern business world. The coordinator of the Postgraduate program is Paulo Rita. The program lasts for 2 semesters. Classes for the program start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. Classes for the program will run after working hours, from 6:30 p.m., 2 to 3 times a week. NOVA IMS programs offer a unique learning experience combining theory and innovative teaching practices.
Paulo Rita holds the title of Full Professor. Paulo Rita's email is prita@novaims.unl.pt.

The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks students with the potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Jury Panel evaluates qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in both academic and professional paths. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025 to enter the program. Applicants must be proficient in English, both spoken and written, to enter the program. To apply, applicants need to access the NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants must fill in the form in the NOVA IMS' user area, providing personal, academic, and professional background details. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as a mandatory document for the application. Applicants may optionally upload other relevant documents to enrich their application. Admitted applicants must submit their bachelor's or master's degree completion certificate within one month. Admitted applicants may alternatively submit a certificate of attendance if their degree is not yet completed. Applicants must choose the program during the application process. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program within a 1,000-character limit, including spaces. Applicants must pay the €51 application fee to complete their application. The €51 application fee is non-refundable in the case of withdrawal or non-admission. The selection process is based on the analysis of the academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions' Jury Panel may hold interviews with some or all applicants. Interviews for the program may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. The registration fee for the program must be paid after admission and confirmation of enrollment. The registration fee is deductible from the program's tuition fee. The registration fee is non-refundable in the case of withdrawal. The registration fee for EU applicants is €1,250. The registration fee for non-EU applicants is €2,500 unless provided by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay an enrollment fee of €35. The enrollment fee of €35 is updated annually. Upon registration, students must pay an annual school insurance fee of €1.40.

Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Full tuition payment must be made between September 25th and September 30th, 2025. The first installment of 25% of the tuition fee must be paid between September 25th and September 30th, 2025. The second installment of 25% of the tuition fee must be paid between November 25th and November 30th, 2025. The third installment of 25% of the tuition fee must be paid between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The fourth installment of 25% of the tuition fee must be paid between April 25th and April 30th, 2026.

The annual school insurance fee of €1.40 is updated annually. The tuition fee for EU applicants is €4,200. The tuition fee for non-EU applicants is €4,900. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments.
Scholarship and award opportunities are available for NOVA IMS programs. Further information about scholarships and awards is available on the NOVA IMS website.

Marketing professionals increasingly use decision support systems to sustain their brands and products in the marketplace. Adopting analytical approaches to understand and create competitive advantages has gained greater importance. The Postgraduate Program in Digital Marketing and Analytics provides a solid foundation to meet new marketing challenges. The Postgraduate Program in Digital Marketing and Analytics allows building a strategic and integrated customer vision online and offline. The Postgraduate Program in Digital Marketing and Analytics contributes to improving the decision-making process in companies. The Postgraduate Program in Digital Marketing and Analytics has been ranked the best program in E-Business and Digital Marketing in Portugal for the third time in a row. The Postgraduate Program in Digital Marketing and Analytics has been ranked the third best program in Western Europe in E-Business and Digital Marketing. The rankings were published by Eduniversal, an international agency. The Postgraduate Program in Digital Marketing and Analytics provides access to the Master Degree Program in Data-Driven Marketing. The Master Degree Program in Data-Driven Marketing has a specialization in Digital Marketing and Analytics. Paulo Rita is the Program Coordinator of the Postgraduate Program in Digital Marketing and Analytics.
Eduniversal publishes the annual ranking of the best MBA and Master programs worldwide.

The Master Degree Program is offered in working hour or after working hour formats. Applications for the Postgraduate Program in Digital Marketing and Analytics are open from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. Classes for the Postgraduate Program start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. Classes run after 6:30 p.m., 2 to 3 times a week. The Postgraduate Program lasts 2 semesters. Applications for the program are open from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. Applications must be submitted through NOVA IMS' Applications Portal.
Paulo Rita is a Full Professor.
Paulo Rita's email address is prita@novaims.unl.pt.

The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS looks for excellent students to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions' Jury Panel values maturity, determination, and motivation in academic and professional paths. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English, both spoken and written. Applicants need to fill in the form in the user area, including personal, academic, and professional background. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae, which is mandatory. Applicants have the option to include other relevant documents besides their Curriculum Vitae. If admitted, applicants must submit their bachelor's or master's degree completion certificate within one month. Applicants are required to choose the program they are applying for. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program, limited to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee to finalize their submission. An email confirming the application submission is sent after the application fee payment. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions' Jury Panel may hold interviews with some applicants, either face-to-face or through videoconference. The application fee is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in cases of withdrawal or non-admission. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants from European Union member countries. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants from other nationalities unless provided by an official entity. Upon registration, a €35 enrollment fee must be paid.

Full tuition payment is due between September 25th and September 30th, 2025. The first tuition installment (25%) is due between September 25th and September 30th, 2025. The fourth tuition installment (25%) is due between April 25th and April 30th, 2026.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Digital Transformation recognizes the significance of digital transformation in today's business world. The Postgraduate Program in Digital Transformation aims to strengthen NOVA IMS's training offering in the area of digital transformation. The program focuses on exploring technological advancements and processes to help organizations enhance their competitive advantage. The program explores the transformation or development of business models to improve competitive advantage. Digital transformation is increasingly crucial for companies to remain relevant and competitive. Training in the area of digital transformation is important for companies. By participating in the Postgraduate Program, professionals will gain a deeper understanding of how to leverage technology to drive business growth. By participating in the program, professionals will gain competences to create new opportunities. The Postgraduate Program in Digital Transformation gives access to the Master's Degree in Information Management, with a specialization in Digital Transformation. Applications for the Postgraduate Program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The goal of the program is to train technicians and managers capable of formulating digital transformation processes in organizations. The goal of the program is to train technicians and managers capable of evaluating digital transformation processes in organizations. The program presents solutions aimed at increasing productivity and efficiency in organizations. The program emphasizes efficient and secure data management. The program lasts 2 semesters. The classes for the program will start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. The program's classes run after working hours (after 6:30 p.m.), 2 to 3 times a week. The application phase for the program is from May 19th to June 18th, 2025.

Mauro Castelli is the Program Coordinator of NOVA IMS. Mauro Castelli holds the title of Full Professor. Mauro Castelli's email address is mcastelli@novaims.unl.pt. Fernando Bação's email address is bacao@novaims.unl.pt.
