The third installment of the tuition fee (25%) must be paid between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026.
The fourth installment of the tuition fee (25%) must be paid between April 25th and April 30th, 2026.
Discounts may be available for tuition fees.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Financial and Budgetary Management and Control was developed in partnership with the Inspectorate General of Finance – Portuguese Audit Authority (IGF). The Postgraduate Program in Financial and Budgetary Management and Control aims to empower participants with competencies in management and financial control. These competencies enable the development of new information management strategies relevant to the performance of functions in the financial and budgetary sphere. The program is focused on scientific and professional development in financial and budgetary management. The program intends to provide solid theoretical-practical training for professionals working in financial and budgetary management. The program is suitable for professionals working in the financial and budgetary management area in public entities. The program is suitable for professionals working in the financial and budgetary management area in private entities. The program aims to address the most recent developments in management, control, and financial reporting. The program aims to transmit an integrated view of financial and budgetary management functional areas through integrated and interdisciplinary training. The program includes analysis and requirements of accounting and internal control systems. The program emphasizes the importance of procedures that enable adequate management control. Applications for the program are open between May 19th, 2025, and June 18th, 2025. Pedro Simões Coelho is the Program Coordinator of NOVA IMS for this postgraduate program. The Postgraduate Program lasts 2 semesters. The classes for the program start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. The classes are held during the day, once a week. The classes are taught in Portuguese. The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students for the program.
Pedro Simões Coelho is a Full Professor at NOVA IMS. The email address of Pedro Simões Coelho is psc@novaims.unl.pt.

The Admissions' Jury Panel is looking for students with the potential to become good technical staff. The Admissions' Jury Panel is looking for students with the potential to become excellent managers. The Jury Panel values qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible area to apply for the program. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The members of the Admissions’ Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with applicants. The interviews may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference.
These qualities are valued in both academic paths and professional careers.

The bachelor's degree must be completed by September 2025. Applicants need to access NOVA IMS' Applications Portal to apply. Applicants must fill in the form available in the user area on the portal. The application form includes personal, academic, and professional background information. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as part of their application. The Curriculum Vitae is the only mandatory document for application. Applicants may attach other documents they consider relevant to enrich their application. Relevant documents may include a certificate of completion of a bachelor's degree. Relevant documents may include a certificate of completion of a master's degree. Admitted applicants must submit their completed bachelor's and/or master's degree certificate within one month. Applicants who have not completed their degree must submit a certificate of attendance within one month if admitted. Applicants must choose the program they wish to apply to. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program. The goals and motivation statement must be limited to 1,000 characters, including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee to complete their application. Applicants receive an email confirming their submitted application after completing all steps. The application fee for the program is €51. The application will only be deemed submitted after payment of the application fee within the stipulated period. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The application fee is non-refundable in case of non-admission to the program. Admitted applicants must make a payment of a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants from a European Union member country. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants from other nationalities unless registration is provided by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay an enrollment fee of €35. The value of the enrollment fee is updated annually.

Upon registration, students must pay an annual school insurance fee of €1.40. The value of the annual school insurance fee is updated annually. The tuition fee for applicants from a European Union member country is €4,100 for installment payments. The tuition fee for applicants from a European Union member country is €4,000 for payment in full. The tuition fee for NOVA IMS alumni (from other programs) with European Union nationality is €3,300. The tuition fee for applicants of other nationalities is €4,900 for installment payments. The tuition fee for applicants of other nationalities is €4,800 for payment in full. The tuition fee for NOVA IMS alumni (from other programs) of other nationalities is €3,900. The tuition fee for companies financing the program for 2 employees is €3,500 per student. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul get the same discount as companies financing for 2 employees. Members' spouses and descendants can also receive the discount if valid documentation is presented. The tuition fee is €3,100 per student for companies financing the program for at least 3 employees. Tuition fees can be paid in full or in four installments. Full tuition payment dates range from October 25th to October 31st, 2025. The first tuition installment payment dates are September 25th to September 30th, 2025 (25% of tuition fee). The second tuition installment payment dates are November 25th to November 30th, 2025 (25% of tuition fee). The third tuition installment payment dates are February 22nd to February 28th, 2026 (25% of tuition fee). The fourth tuition installment payment dates are April 25th to April 30th, 2026 (25% of tuition fee).

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Financial Markets and Risks is offered through a partnership between NOVA Information Management School and ISCTE Executive Education. The program combines a prestigious teaching staff that aligns knowledge and scientific rigor with practical experience. The program includes current and innovative contents with a strong applied component. The program promotes the development of analytical skills for decision-making in asset and liability management. The program encourages the development of techniques and processes for financial innovation. The program includes training in the development and evaluation of new financial products, asset classes, and operations.

The program is structured to provide specialized training for staff in financial sectors. The training focuses on the creation, analysis, and assessment of financial instruments. The program has a particular focus on derivatives. The program includes training in the identification and implementation of integrated technical analysis. The program includes training in the management of assets, liabilities, and financial risks. The program is designed under the best international standards set by the CFA Institute's Global Body of Investment Knowledge. The program references the Financial Risk Manager (FRM) certification of the Global Association of Risk Professionals (GARP). The program covers all key knowledge required for professionals in the financial system. The Postgraduate Program is accredited as a GARP Academic Partner. GARP recognizes that the program covers at least 70% of the body of knowledge required for the FRM Part I and Part II examinations. This Postgraduate Program provides access to a Master Degree Program in Risk Management. Jorge Miguel Bravo is the Program Coordinator of the Postgraduate Program in Financial Markets and Risks. The program aims to enable detailed analysis and assessment of major financial products and instruments, with a particular focus on derivatives. The program aims to enable the identification and development of integrated technical analysis for managing various financial risks. The program covers financial risk management in terms of coverage, speculation, and arbitrage transactions. The program emphasizes decision-making in the management of investment portfolios, treasury, pension funds, and investment funds.
Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The program starts in September 2025 and ends in June 2026. The application phase runs from May 19th to June 18th, 2025.

Applicants can apply via a provided link to the application portal. Applications must be submitted through NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants need to fill out the form providing personal, academic, and professional background details. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae, which is the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants can optionally attach other documents, such as certificates of completion of degrees. Admitted applicants must submit their degree completion certificates within one month of admission. Applicants must select the program while completing the application form. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program in up to 1,000 characters, including spaces. Applicants must pay an application fee to complete their application submission. The application fee is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission.
Jorge Miguel Bravo is an Associate Professor.
Jorge Miguel Bravo's email is jbravo@novaims.unl.pt.
Classes are held after working hours, after 6:30 p.m., 2 to 3 times a week.
Classes take place at NOVA IMS in Lisbon.

The Admissions Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students with potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions Jury Panel evaluates qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in academic and professional careers. Applicants must have a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English, both spoken and written. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with some or all applicants. Interviews can be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference.

The tuition fee for the postgraduate program is €7,500. The tuition fee includes materials prepared by the faculty, coffee breaks, and parking at the NOVA IMS campus in Lisbon. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee shortly after the admission result announcement. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the postgraduate program's tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants from European Union member countries. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants from non-European Union countries. Applicants must pay €35 as the enrollment fee upon registration. Applicants must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance upon registration. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments. The full payment deadline is between September 25th and 30th, 2023. The first installment (25% of tuition fee) deadline is between September 25th and 30th, 2023. The second installment (25% of tuition fee) deadline is between November 25th and 30th, 2023. The third installment (25% of tuition fee) deadline is between February 22nd and 28th, 2024. The fourth installment (25% of tuition fee) deadline is between April 25th and 30th, 2024. Students who choose to pay the tuition fee in full receive a 2.5% financial discount. Alumni of NOVA IMS, ISCTE Executive Education, and ISCTE-IUL from a different program receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount. Companies financing the program for two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The company discount for two employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The company discount for three or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% tuition fee discount. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount extends to members' spouses and descendants upon presentation of valid documentation. For more information regarding the Ordem dos Engenheiros discount, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Admissions Procedures & Requirements
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains details about the admissions process at NOVA IMS, covering criteria, objectives, qualifications, English proficiency, curriculum evaluation, and interview procedures.
chunks_for_embedding.content: The Admissions Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students with potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions Jury Panel evaluates qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in academic and professional careers. Applicants must have a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English, both spoken and written. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with some or all applicants. Interviews can be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference.

propositions: The Admissions Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students with potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers.

Applicants must be proficient in English, both spoken and written.
The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum.
The Admissions Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with some or all applicants.
Interviews can be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Financial Details & Payment Conditions
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains detailed information about financial aspects and payment conditions for a postgraduate program, including tuition fees, payment plans, discounts, eligibility criteria, deadlines, and non-refundable fees.
chunks_for_embedding.content: The tuition fee for the postgraduate program is €7,500. The tuition fee includes materials prepared by the faculty, coffee breaks, and parking at the NOVA IMS campus in Lisbon. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee shortly after the admission result announcement. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the postgraduate program's tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants from European Union member countries. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants from non-European Union countries. Applicants must pay €35 as the enrollment fee upon registration. Applicants must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance upon registration. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments. The full payment deadline is between September 25th and 30th, 2023. The first installment (25% of tuition fee) deadline is between September 25th and 30th, 2023. The second installment (25% of tuition fee) deadline is between November 25th and 30th, 2023. The third installment (25% of tuition fee) deadline is between February 22nd and 28th, 2024. The fourth installment (25% of tuition fee) deadline is between April 25th and 30th, 2024. Students who choose to pay the tuition fee in full receive a 2.5% financial discount. Alumni of NOVA IMS, ISCTE Executive Education, and ISCTE-IUL from a different program receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount. Companies financing the program for two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The company discount for two employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The company discount for three or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% tuition fee discount. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount extends to members' spouses and descendants upon presentation of valid documentation. For more information regarding the Ordem dos Engenheiros discount, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science provides a technical and scientific framework related to the use of geographic information technology and analysis. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science provides skills related to the modeling and analysis of spatial data. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science provides skills related to the design and planning of geographic information technology and analysis in organizations. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science is developed in collaboration with UNIGIS. UNIGIS is an international network that brings together the best schools in Geographic Information Systems and Science. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science gives access to the Geospatial Intelligence (GEOINT) certificate. The Geospatial Intelligence (GEOINT) certificate is accredited by the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF). The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science lasts two semesters. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science is taught in b-learning or e-learning formats. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science gives access to the Master Degree Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science. The classes for the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science will start in September 2025. The classes for the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science will end in June 2026. Applications for the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science aims to develop strategies, methodologies, and tools for geographic information management. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science aims to support the analysis of questions raised when using geographic information. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science aims to model, monitor, and simulate geographic, demographic, and environmental phenomena. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science aims to address diverse analysis contexts related to geographic information. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science aims to use exploration and analysis methodologies and tools to reduce levels of uncertainty in solving geographical problems. The Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science aims to design and develop information systems and technologies for geographic information needs in organizations. The coordinator of the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science is Marco Painho. The application phase for the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science runs from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. Applicants to the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science can hold a degree in Statistics and Information Management, Geography, Economics, Engineering, Computer Sciences, Physics, Mathematics, Architecture, Urban and Regional Planning, or other relevant scientific fields. Applicants to the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science must provide their degree for approval by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS. Applicants to the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science from the Bologna legislation must hold a degree conferred under the 1st cycle of studies by an adherent European country. Applicants to the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science can hold a foreign academic degree approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS.
Marco Painho is a Full Professor. Marco Painho's email address is painho@novaims.unl.pt.

NOVA IMS seeks students with potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. NOVA IMS requires qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation for admission. Applicants to the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science should hold a relevant bachelor's degree. Applicants admitted to the program must submit a Bachelor's or Master's degree completion certificate or certificate of attendance within one month. The selection process for the program is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may hold interviews with some or all applicants either face-to-face or via videoconference.

Applicants to the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science can present a relevant academic, professional, or scientific curriculum approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS. To apply for the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science, applicants must access the NOVA IMS Applications Portal. To apply for the Postgraduate Program, applicants must fill in a form with personal, academic, and professional background details. Applicants to the program must upload their Curriculum Vitae as the only mandatory document for application. Applicants can provide additional relevant documents such as certificates for completed Bachelor's or Master's degrees. To apply for the Postgraduate Program, applicants must choose the program on the application form. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program, limited to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee to complete the application process. Upon application submission, applicants receive an email confirming their submitted application. The application fee for the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science is €51. Applications are only considered after payment of the non-refundable application fee within the stipulated period. Applicants admitted to the program must make a pre-registration payment within one week of the admission result announcement. The pre-registration payment is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration payment is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants with a nationality from a European Union member country. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants of other nationalities unless covered by an official entity. A €35 enrollment fee must be paid upon registration. A €1.40 school insurance fee must be paid annually upon registration. The enrollment fee is updated annually.

The school insurance fee is updated annually. The registration fee for the second year and subsequent years is €35 annually. The tuition fee for the Postgraduate Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science is €3,200. Applicants can pay the tuition fee in full or in two installments. Full payment of the tuition fee must be made between September 25th and 30th, 2025. The first installment (50%) of the tuition fee must be paid between September 25th and 30th, 2025. The second installment (50%) of the tuition fee must be paid between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. Students who pay the tuition fee in a single payment receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni receive a 20% discount on the tuition fee. The alumni discount is cumulative with the single payment discount. Companies financing the program for two employees receive a 10% discount on the tuition fee. The company discount for two employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees receive a 20% discount on the tuition fee. The company discount for three or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. Members' spouses and descendants can receive the Ordem dos Engenheiros discount upon presenting valid documentation. For more information on membership discounts, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science provides the necessary skills for the analysis, modeling, and visualization of geographic information. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science aims to train professionals for the role of artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining. Artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining can be used to develop solutions to challenges and societal problems in the public and private sectors. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is developed in collaboration with UNIGIS. UNIGIS is an international network that brings together the best schools in Geographic Information Systems and Science. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science gives access to the Geospatial Intelligence (GEOINT) certificate accredited by the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF). The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science lasts two semesters. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is taught in b-learning formats. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is taught in e-learning formats. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science gives access to the Master Degree Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science. Applications for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The goal of the program is to understand and contribute to the great technical and social challenges created by computing environments rich in geospatial data. The program aims to teach how geospatial data can be acquired and used to support various analysis, modeling, and geovisualization processes. The program seeks to teach how artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining can be used to enhance concepts and flows of geographic information science. The Program Coordinator for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is Marco Painho. NOVA IMS is looking for excellent students for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science. The application phase for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is from May 19th until June 18th, 2025. Applicants for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science should hold a relevant bachelor's degree or equivalent. The application fee for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is €51.
Computing environments rich in geospatial data include its architecture, integrity, and management. Geospatial data can be used in large data environments.

Artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining can provide institution-centric solutions to public sector challenges. Artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining can provide institution-centric solutions to societal problems.
Artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining can provide institution-centric solutions to private sector challenges.
Marco Painho is a Full Professor. Marco Painho's email address is painho@novaims.unl.pt. Admissions inquiries can be sent to admissions@novaims.unl.pt.

NOVA IMS seeks students who have the potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. Qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in the academic path are required attributes for admission. Qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in the professional career are required attributes for admission. Applicants should have a bachelor's degree in Statistics and Information Management, Geography, Economics, Engineering, Computer Sciences, Physics, Mathematics, Architecture, Urban and Regional Planning, or other relevant scientific fields. Relevant scientific fields for the application should be approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS. Applications are accepted from people holding a higher education level conferred on the 1st cycle of studies under the Bologna legislation by an adherent European country. Applications are accepted from people holding a foreign academic degree approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS. Foreign academic degrees must achieve undergraduate goals to be accepted. Applications are accepted from people holding relevant academic, professional, and scientific curriculum approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS. Holding relevant academic, professional, and scientific curriculum allows completion of this study program. To apply to this program, you need to access the NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. The first step of application is to fill in the form available in the user area. The form requires information on personal, academic, and professional background. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae to the portal during application. Uploading the Curriculum Vitae document is mandatory for application. Applicants can optionally include other documents to enrich their application. Applicants can submit certificates of completion for their Bachelor's and/or Master's degree. Applicants can submit relevant documents for certificates of attendance if their degree is not yet completed. Admitted applicants must submit their Bachelor's and/or Master's degree completion certificate within one month. Admitted applicants must submit their certificate of attendance within one month if their degree is not yet completed. Applicants must choose the program they are applying for. Applicants must present goals and motivation for applying to the program. The character limit for presenting goals and motivation is 1,000 characters, including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee to complete their application. After completing the application, applicants will receive an email confirming their submission. The selection process for applicants is based on the analysis of their academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may decide to hold an interview with all or some applicants. The interview may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. Applications can only be considered after payment of the application fee. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The application fee is non-refundable in case of non-admission into the program. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee after confirming enrollment. Pre-registration payment is due around one week after the admission result announcement. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. Applicants with European Union nationality must pay a pre-registration fee of €1,250. Applicants with other nationalities must pay a pre-registration fee of €2,500. The registration fee is provided by an official entity for applicants from non-European nationalities. All students must pay an enrollment fee of €35 annually upon registration.

The annual school insurance fee is €1.40 annually upon registration. Both the enrollment fee and the school insurance fee are updated annually. The registration fee for the second year and following years is €35. The tuition fee for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is €3,200. The tuition fee can be paid in full. The tuition fee can be paid in two installments. Full payment dates for the tuition fee are from September 25th to 30th, 2025. The first installment of tuition fee payment is 50% of the amount and is due from September 25th to 30th, 2025. The second installment of tuition fee payment is 50% of the amount and is due from February 22nd to 28th, 2026. Students paying tuition fees in a single payment receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni with bachelor's, postgraduate, master's, or doctoral degrees receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The NOVA IMS alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount. Companies financing programs for 2 employees in the same academic year receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The 10% tuition fee discount for companies is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing programs for 3 or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The 20% tuition fee discount for companies is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% tuition fee discount. The 15% tuition fee discount extends to spouses and descendants upon presentation of valid documentation. The 15% discount for Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul members is not cumulative with other financial discounts.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Postgraduate Geospatial Data Science Programs
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains information about postgraduate programs in geospatial data science, including curriculum details, certifications, collaborations, learning formats, duration, degree pathways, application processes, prerequisites, societal applications, geospatial data use cases, and program leadership.
chunks_for_embedding.content: The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science provides the necessary skills for the analysis, modeling, and visualization of geographic information. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science aims to train professionals for the role of artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining. Artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining can be used to develop solutions to challenges and societal problems in the public and private sectors. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is developed in collaboration with UNIGIS. UNIGIS is an international network that brings together the best schools in Geographic Information Systems and Science. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science gives access to the Geospatial Intelligence (GEOINT) certificate accredited by the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF). The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science lasts two semesters. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is taught in b-learning formats. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is taught in e-learning formats. The Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science gives access to the Master Degree Program in Geographic Information Systems and Science. Applications for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The goal of the program is to understand and contribute to the great technical and social challenges created by computing environments rich in geospatial data. The program aims to teach how geospatial data can be acquired and used to support various analysis, modeling, and geovisualization processes. The program seeks to teach how artificial intelligence, programming, and data mining can be used to enhance concepts and flows of geographic information science. The Program Coordinator for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is Marco Painho. NOVA IMS is looking for excellent students for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science. The application phase for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is from May 19th until June 18th, 2025. Applicants for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science should hold a relevant bachelor's degree or equivalent. The application fee for the Postgraduate Program in Geospatial Data Science is €51.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Admissions & Application Procedures
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk provides detailed information about the NOVA IMS admission process, including eligibility criteria, academic requirements, application procedures, document submissions, payment policies, and selection methods.
chunks_for_embedding.content: NOVA IMS seeks students who have the potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. Qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in the academic path are required attributes for admission. Qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in the professional career are required attributes for admission. Applicants should have a bachelor's degree in Statistics and Information Management, Geography, Economics, Engineering, Computer Sciences, Physics, Mathematics, Architecture, Urban and Regional Planning, or other relevant scientific fields. Relevant scientific fields for the application should be approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS. Applications are accepted from people holding a higher education level conferred on the 1st cycle of studies under the Bologna legislation by an adherent European country. Applications are accepted from people holding a foreign academic degree approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS. Foreign academic degrees must achieve undergraduate goals to be accepted. Applications are accepted from people holding relevant academic, professional, and scientific curriculum approved by the Scientific Council of NOVA IMS. Holding relevant academic, professional, and scientific curriculum allows completion of this study program. To apply to this program, you need to access the NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. The first step of application is to fill in the form available in the user area. The form requires information on personal, academic, and professional background. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae to the portal during application. Uploading the Curriculum Vitae document is mandatory for application. Applicants can optionally include other documents to enrich their application. Applicants can submit certificates of completion for their Bachelor's and/or Master's degree. Applicants can submit relevant documents for certificates of attendance if their degree is not yet completed. Admitted applicants must submit their Bachelor's and/or Master's degree completion certificate within one month. Admitted applicants must submit their certificate of attendance within one month if their degree is not yet completed. Applicants must choose the program they are applying for. Applicants must present goals and motivation for applying to the program. The character limit for presenting goals and motivation is 1,000 characters, including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee to complete their application. After completing the application, applicants will receive an email confirming their submission. The selection process for applicants is based on the analysis of their academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may decide to hold an interview with all or some applicants. The interview may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. Applications can only be considered after payment of the application fee. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The application fee is non-refundable in case of non-admission into the program. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee after confirming enrollment. Pre-registration payment is due around one week after the admission result announcement. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. Applicants with European Union nationality must pay a pre-registration fee of €1,250. Applicants with other nationalities must pay a pre-registration fee of €2,500. The registration fee is provided by an official entity for applicants from non-European nationalities. All students must pay an enrollment fee of €35 annually upon registration.

chunks: The Geospatial Intelligence Certificate is accredited by the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF). The Geospatial Intelligence Certificate provides education and training in scientific concepts, methods, and key geospatial technologies. Key geospatial technologies are used in the solution of global problems of security and defense. Global problems of security and defense include emergency and civil protection, natural disasters, humanitarian crises, environmental risks, and military operations. Global problems of security and defense include political action in general, public health, education, transport, telecommunications, and management dilemmas of heritage. Global problems of security and defense include responding to economic, social, and cultural challenges. The main objective of the Geospatial Intelligence Certificate course is to train technicians capable of applying knowledge of image processing and remote sensing, geographic information science, informatics, and analytical tools to geospatial intelligence. Technicians trained in the course are capable of selecting, using, synthesizing, and demonstrating techniques, skills, and tools needed to solve GEOINT problems. GEOINT problems affect and stimulate society on a day-to-day basis. Students of the program are trained to apply and develop knowledge of image processing and remote sensing to geospatial intelligence. Students of the program are trained to apply and develop knowledge of geographic information science to geospatial intelligence. Students of the program are trained to apply and develop knowledge of computing and analytical processes to geospatial intelligence. Students are expected to investigate, collect, and interpret data leading to complex analyses. The program promotes a network unifying the National GEOINT Community (National GEOINT Network). The aim of the National GEOINT Network is the development and innovation in the field of geospatial intelligence. Students are expected to select, use, synthesize, and demonstrate techniques, skills, and tools necessary to solve geospatial intelligence problems.
Completion of the postgraduate degree guarantees access to the Master Degree in Geographic Information Systems and Science.
Students are expected to work in a collaborative environment.
The program coordinator is Marco Painho. Marco Painho is a Full Professor. The email of Marco Painho is painho@novaims.unl.pt.

The program lasts 2 semesters. The program's classes will start in September 2024. The program's classes will end in June 2025. The program's classes will run after working hours (after 6:30 p.m.), 2 to 3 times a week. The program works on a face-to-face format. The program may offer the possibility for remote participation through synchronous means such as Zoom or Teams.

The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS looks for excellent students with the potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions' Jury Panel values qualities such as maturity, determination, and motivation in academic and professional careers. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025 to enter the program. Applicants must be proficient in spoken and written English to enter the program. To apply, applicants must access NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants must fill in a form in the user area providing personal, academic, and professional background information. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae to apply. Applicants have the option of including additional relevant documents such as certificates of completion of degrees. Admitted applicants must submit completion certificates for their bachelor's and/or master's degrees within one month. Applicants must select the program they wish to apply for. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program in a text limited to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay the application fee to complete their application. Applicants receive an email confirming the submission of their application after paying the application fee. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with all or some applicants. Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. The application fee is €51. Applications are only considered after the payment of the application fee. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee after confirmation of enrollment.

The tuition fee for the postgraduate program is €4,100. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments. Full payment of tuition fees must be made between September 25 and September 30, 2024. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the postgraduate program's tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants from EU and Portuguese-speaking countries. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants from other countries unless their registration fee is provided by an official entity. Students must pay €35 for an enrollment fee upon registration. Students who pay tuition fees in a single payment receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount. Companies financing the program for at least 2 employees in the same academic year receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The discount for financing 2 employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for 3 or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The discount for financing 3 or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants with valid documentation. For more information on Ordem dos Engenheiros discounts, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts.

The first installment payment (25% of the tuition fee) must be made between September 25 and September 30, 2024. The second installment payment (25% of the tuition fee) must be made between November 25 and November 30, 2024. The third installment payment (25% of the tuition fee) must be made between February 22 and February 28, 2025. The fourth installment payment (25% of the tuition fee) must be made between April 25 and April 30, 2025.
Students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance upon registration.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Tuition Fees, Payments & Discounts
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains detailed information about tuition fees, payment options, deadlines, pre-registration and enrollment fees, refund policies, discount types and conditions, and sponsorship arrangements for postgraduate education programs.
chunks_for_embedding.content: The tuition fee for the postgraduate program is €4,100. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments. Full payment of tuition fees must be made between September 25 and September 30, 2024. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the postgraduate program's tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants from EU and Portuguese-speaking countries. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants from other countries unless their registration fee is provided by an official entity. Students must pay €35 for an enrollment fee upon registration. Students who pay tuition fees in a single payment receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount. Companies financing the program for at least 2 employees in the same academic year receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The discount for financing 2 employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for 3 or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The discount for financing 3 or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants with valid documentation. For more information on Ordem dos Engenheiros discounts, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Health Data Science and Analytics is specifically designed for healthcare professionals. The program aims to help healthcare professionals acquire advanced skills in managing health sciences data. The program helps students interpret health sciences data. The program helps students make strategic, data-driven decisions within the health sciences field. The program develops essential analytical skills for data analysis and management in health sciences. The program addresses key questions in public health. The program addresses key questions in biomedical sciences including biology, medicine, physiology, and pharmacology. The program addresses key questions at various decision-making levels within healthcare organizations. The program has a flexible and adaptable curriculum. The curriculum is tailored to each student's personal and professional goals. The program enables a customized learning path. Students can choose courses in high-demand areas in the program. The program is structured around three key pillars. The first key pillar is proficiency in applying analytical methods in healthcare. The second key pillar is the ability to manage and analyze large volumes of data, information, and knowledge within healthcare organizations. The third key pillar is understanding technological innovation and the transformation of business models in the healthcare sector. Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Applicants can apply to the program by clicking a designated link. One goal of the program is to meet the challenges of the new healthcare market using planning and management control instruments. One goal of the program is to understand and manage innovation and change processes in the healthcare market. One goal of the program is to understand and manage customer relationships in the new healthcare market. One goal of the program is to introduce the principles of Information and Knowledge Management. One goal of the program is to promote competitiveness in health sector organizations leveraging Information and Knowledge Management. One goal of the program is to understand the process of Business Intelligence. One goal of the program is to manage Business Intelligence infrastructure components such as individuals, processes, and technologies. One goal of the program is to use analytical applications for monitoring performance in organizations. One goal of the program is to identify key indicators in healthcare analytical applications. The program coordinator is Pedro Simões Coelho. The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS looks for excellent students to enroll in the program. The Admissions' Jury Panel seeks students with potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. Applications for the program are open from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025. To apply, applicants must access the NOVA IMS Applications Portal. Applicants must fill in a form in the portal including their personal, academic, and professional background.
Pedro Simões Coelho is a Full Professor. Pedro Simões Coelho's email is psc@novaims.unl.pt.

The Jury Panel values maturity, determination, and motivation in applicants. Applicants must be proficient in English (spoken and written). Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae to the portal. The Curriculum Vitae is the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants may optionally include other documents in the application. Optional documents may include certificates of completion for bachelor's or master's degrees. If admitted, applicants must submit their degree completion certificates within one month. Applicants can also submit certificates of attendance, if degrees are not yet completed. Applicants must choose the program they are applying to on the portal. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for joining the program in a statement limited to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay the €51 application fee for their application to be considered. The application fee of €51 is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may hold interviews with some applicants. Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee following confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee of the postgraduate program. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. Applicants with European Union nationality must pay a €1,250 pre-registration fee. Applicants without European Union nationality must pay a €2,500 pre-registration fee unless an official entity provides the fee. Students must pay a €35 enrollment fee upon registration. The enrollment fee of €35 is updated annually. The tuition fee for applicants with European Union nationality is €4,200. The tuition fee for applicants without European Union nationality is €4,900. The tuition fee can be paid in full between September 25th to 30th, 2025. Alternatively, the tuition fee can be paid in four installments. The first installment payment deadline is September 25th to 30th, 2025.

Students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance upon registration. The annual school insurance fee of €1.40 is updated annually. The second installment payment deadline is November 25th to 30th, 2025. The third installment payment deadline is February 22nd to 28th, 2026. The fourth installment payment deadline is April 25th to 30th, 2026. Students who pay the tuition fee in full receive a 2.5% discount. NOVA IMS alumni receive a 20% discount on the tuition fee. Alumni discounts are cumulative with the financial discount. Companies financing at least 2 employees in the same academic year receive a 10% tuition fee discount. Companies financing at least 3 employees in the same academic year receive a 20% tuition fee discount. Public health institution participants receive a 10% tuition fee discount. Members of Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% tuition fee discount. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount extends to members' spouses and descendants. Ordem dos Engenheiros members must provide valid documentation for the discount. For information on the Ordem dos Engenheiros discount, contact admissions@novaims.unl.pt. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other discounts.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Information Management and Business Intelligence in Healthcare aims to train managers and healthcare professionals. The program is intended for those who wish to use information and knowledge management to promote the competitiveness of healthcare organizations. The program covers a wide range of topics, including health policy, strategy, information systems, and data science. The program prepares future leaders for a dynamic and complex healthcare industry. The main focus of the program is to provide practical skills and tools. The program supports innovation, process improvement, and better decision-making based on analytical and business intelligence tools. Eduniversal ranked this Postgraduate Program as the 2nd best program in the world in Health Management. The program is an initiative of four academic units of Universidade Nova de Lisboa: NOVA IMS, ENSP-NOVA, NMS | FCM, and IHMT. Applications for this program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Applications are open only for Portuguese-speaking applicants during this period. The program lasts 2 semesters. Classes for the program will start in February 2026 and end in December 2026. The classes will run after working hours, starting after 6:30 p.m., 2 to 3 times a week. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by January 2026 to enter the program. Applicants must be proficient in English, both spoken and written. Applications must be submitted through NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants need to fill out the form available in the user area on the portal. Applicants must provide their personal, academic, and professional background in the application form. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as a mandatory document for application. Applicants may optionally attach other relevant documents, such as certificates of bachelor's or master's degrees. Admitted applicants must submit their degree completion certificates or certificates of attendance within one month of admission if applicable. Applicants must choose the program they are applying for in the portal. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program, limited to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay an application fee to complete their submission. Applicants will receive an email confirming their submitted application after completing the application steps. The selection process is based on an analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with all or some applicants. Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. The fee for application is €51. The application fee must be paid within the stipulated period. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee of the program. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants of other nationalities unless covered by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay €35 as an enrollment fee. The enrollment fee value is updated annually. The tuition fee for this postgraduate program is €4,100 for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country. The tuition fee for this postgraduate program is €4,900 for applicants of other nationalities. Applications submitted before June 18th receive a €100 discount on the tuition fee. The program coordinator is Guilherme Victorino. The program combines theory with the application of innovative teaching practices.
Eduniversal is an international agency that publishes the annual ranking of the best MBA and Master programs in the world.

Upon registration, students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance. The annual school insurance value is updated annually. Students who pay the tuition fee in a single payment receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni who completed a bachelor's, postgraduate, master's, or doctoral degree at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount for single payment. Companies financing the program for at least two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The two-employee company discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The three-employee discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Participants from public health institutions receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The public health institution discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. Ordem dos Engenheiros members' spouses and descendants may also receive the 15% discount upon presentation of valid documentation. The program offers special discount conditions and various payment methods. Students who pay tuition fees in a single payment between February 22nd and 28th, 2026, receive a 2.5% discount. Students paying tuition fees in four installments must pay 25% of the fee between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. The second tuition fee installment of 25% must be paid between April 25th and 30th, 2026. The third tuition fee installment of 25% must be paid between September 25th and 30th, 2026. The fourth tuition fee installment of 25% must be paid between November 25th and 30th, 2026. Scholarship and award opportunities are available for NOVA IMS students. Students can explore scholarship and award opportunities on the NOVA IMS website.

Guilherme Victorino holds the title of Assistant Professor. Guilherme Victorino's email is gmvictorino@novaims.unl.pt. José Caiado holds the title of Invited Assistant Professor. José Caiado's email is jccaiado@novaims.unl.pt.
The program coordinator is José Caiado.
The program offers a unique learning experience.

The program supports innovation, process improvement, and better decision-making based on analytical and business intelligence tools.
Eduniversal ranked this Postgraduate Program as the 2nd best program in the world in Health Management.
The program is an initiative of four academic units of Universidade Nova de Lisboa: NOVA IMS, ENSP-NOVA, NMS | FCM, and IHMT.
Applications for this program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025.
Applications are open only for Portuguese-speaking applicants during this period.
The program lasts 2 semesters.
Classes for the program will start in February 2026 and end in December 2026.
The classes will run after working hours, starting after 6:30 p.m., 2 to 3 times a week.
Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by January 2026 to enter the program.
Applicants must be proficient in English, both spoken and written.
Applications must be submitted through NOVA IMS' Applications Portal.
Applicants need to fill out the form available in the user area on the portal.
Applicants must provide their personal, academic, and professional background in the application form.
Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as a mandatory document for application.
Applicants may optionally attach other relevant documents, such as certificates of bachelor's or master's degrees.
Admitted applicants must submit their degree completion certificates or certificates of attendance within one month of admission if applicable.
Applicants must choose the program they are applying for in the portal.
Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program, limited to 1,000 characters including spaces.
Applicants must pay an application fee to complete their submission.
Applicants will receive an email confirming their submitted application after completing the application steps.
The selection process is based on an analysis of academic and professional curriculum.
The Admissions Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with all or some applicants.
Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference.
The fee for application is €51.
The application fee must be paid within the stipulated period.
The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program.
Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment.
The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee of the program.
The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal.
The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country.
The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants of other nationalities unless covered by an official entity.
Upon registration, students must pay €35 as an enrollment fee.
The enrollment fee value is updated annually.
The tuition fee for this postgraduate program is €4,100 for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country.
The tuition fee for this postgraduate program is €4,900 for applicants of other nationalities.
Applications submitted before June 18th receive a €100 discount on the tuition fee.
The program coordinator is Guilherme Victorino.
The program combines theory with the application of innovative teaching practices.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Tuition & Financial Opportunities
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk provides comprehensive information about tuition fees, discount policies, eligibility criteria, school insurance, payment schedules, methods, scholarship and award opportunities, and special conditions for students, alumni, companies, public institutions, organization members, and their families at NOVA IMS, including specific payment deadlines.
chunks_for_embedding.content: Upon registration, students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance. The annual school insurance value is updated annually. Students who pay the tuition fee in a single payment receive a 2.5% financial discount. NOVA IMS alumni who completed a bachelor's, postgraduate, master's, or doctoral degree at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount for single payment. Companies financing the program for at least two employees in the same academic year receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The two-employee company discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing the program for three or more employees in the same academic year receive a 20% discount on tuition fees. The three-employee discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Participants from public health institutions receive a 10% discount on tuition fees. The public health institution discount is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. Ordem dos Engenheiros members' spouses and descendants may also receive the 15% discount upon presentation of valid documentation. The program offers special discount conditions and various payment methods. Students who pay tuition fees in a single payment between February 22nd and 28th, 2026, receive a 2.5% discount. Students paying tuition fees in four installments must pay 25% of the fee between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. The second tuition fee installment of 25% must be paid between April 25th and 30th, 2026. The third tuition fee installment of 25% must be paid between September 25th and 30th, 2026. The fourth tuition fee installment of 25% must be paid between November 25th and 30th, 2026. Scholarship and award opportunities are available for NOVA IMS students. Students can explore scholarship and award opportunities on the NOVA IMS website.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management explores various technologies in IT and their impact on planning, design, functionality, and information systems management. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management focuses on understanding the interaction between technology and business processes, strategy, and organizational policies. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management promotes strategic thinking regarding the role of information systems in developing management strategies. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management promotes information sharing to increase the competitiveness of organizations. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management is aimed at managers and experts in the coordination and development of information systems projects. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management is aimed at professionals involved in IT auditing, quality control, and strategic management of information systems. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management gives access to the Master Degree Program in Information Management with a specialization in Information Systems Management. The Master Degree Program in Information Systems Management with a specialization in Information Systems Management is ranked as the best in Portugal by Eduniversal. The Master Degree Program in Information Systems Management with a specialization in Information Systems Management is ranked as the best in Western Europe by Eduniversal. Applications for the Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management has the goal to develop strategies, methods, and tools for knowledge and information systems management. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management has the goal to analyze organizational contexts and their significance in establishing innovative methods based on the most recent technological advances. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management has the goal to master the processes and tools used for the storage, organization, and access to information in organizations. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management has the goal to improve organizational efficiency through the creation and design of business processes. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management has the goal to create and develop information systems and technologies that meet organizations' information needs. The Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management lasts 2 semesters. The classes for the Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management will start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. The application phase for the Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management is from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. To apply to the Postgraduate Program in Information Systems Management, applicants need to access the NOVA IMS' Applications Portal.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Intelligence Management and Security develops skills to understand and address challenges in security, defense, international cooperation, and information culture. The program provides analytical competencies and methodologies to assess, manage, and make decisions in complex international security and defense contexts. International security and defense contexts require an understanding of political, diplomatic, economic, social, and regional frameworks. Risks and challenges in international security include cybersecurity, counterintelligence, Artificial Intelligence, foresight, and scenario planning. Applications for this program are open from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. The program lasts 2 semesters. The program starts in February 2026 and ends in December 2026. Classes run after working hours (after 6:30 p.m.), two times a week. To enter the program, applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by January 2026. Applicants must be proficient in Portuguese (spoken and written). The program is taught in Portuguese. Applications for the program are open to Portuguese-speaking applicants only. The application fee for the program is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission. The tuition fee for the program is €4,100 for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country. The tuition fee for the program is €4,900 for applicants with nationalities outside the European Union. A €100 discount will be applied to the tuition fees for applications submitted by June 18th, 2025. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments. The full tuition fee payment is due between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The first installment payment of the tuition fee, 25% of the total, is due between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The second installment payment of the tuition fee, 25% of the total, is due between April 25th and April 30th, 2026. The third installment payment of the tuition fee, 25% of the total, is due between September 25th and September 30th, 2026. The fourth installment payment of the tuition fee, 25% of the total, is due between November 25th and November 30th, 2026. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee within approximately one week after the admission announcement. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the program's tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for applicants with nationalities outside the European Union is €2,500 unless provided by an official entity. Students must pay €35 for an enrollment fee upon registration. The enrollment fee is updated annually. Applicants must use NOVA IMS' Applications Portal to apply. To apply, applicants must fill out the form available in the user area, including personal, academic, and professional background. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants may attach additional documents, such as certificates of degree completion, but these are optional. If admitted, applicants must submit certificates of degree completion or attendance within one month. Applicants must choose the program they are applying to in the application form. Applicants must present their goals and motivations for applying to the program (limited to 1,000 characters, including spaces). Applicants must pay the application fee to complete the application process. Applicants will receive an email confirming the submitted application after payment of the application fee. The selection process is based on an analysis of applicants' academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions Jury Panel may hold interviews with all or some applicants during the selection process. Interviews for the selection process may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. The program aims to help students analyze risks, threats, and opportunities in today's BANI world (Brittle, Anxious, Nonlinear, and Incomprehensible). The program aims to help students demonstrate knowledge of intelligence and information gathering techniques. The program addresses challenges posed by cybersecurity, counterintelligence, and Artificial Intelligence.

Students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance upon registration. The annual school insurance fee is updated annually. Students who pay the tuition fee in a single payment receive a 2.5% discount. NOVA IMS alumni who have completed a bachelor's, postgraduate, master's, or doctoral degree at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on the tuition fee. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount for single tuition fee payments. Companies financing at least two employees in the same academic year for the program receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The corporate discount for two employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing three or more employees in the same academic year for the program receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The corporate discount for three or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The 15% Ordem dos Engenheiros discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants upon valid documentation. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts. Employees of specific ministries receive a 15% tuition fee discount. The ministries eligible for the tuition fee discount are the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Ministry of National Defense, the Ministry of Economy, the Ministry of Finance, and the Ministry of Justice. The 15% discount for employees of ministries is not cumulative with other discounts.
