chunks_for_embedding.title: Postgraduate Program in International Security: Curriculum, Admission & Fees
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk provides comprehensive details about a postgraduate program in international security and defense, including its curriculum, focus areas, eligibility criteria, application and admission processes, fees and payment schedules, language requirements, and class logistics.
chunks_for_embedding.content: The Postgraduate Program in Intelligence Management and Security develops skills to understand and address challenges in security, defense, international cooperation, and information culture. The program provides analytical competencies and methodologies to assess, manage, and make decisions in complex international security and defense contexts. International security and defense contexts require an understanding of political, diplomatic, economic, social, and regional frameworks. Risks and challenges in international security include cybersecurity, counterintelligence, Artificial Intelligence, foresight, and scenario planning. Applications for this program are open from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. The program lasts 2 semesters. The program starts in February 2026 and ends in December 2026. Classes run after working hours (after 6:30 p.m.), two times a week. To enter the program, applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by January 2026. Applicants must be proficient in Portuguese (spoken and written). The program is taught in Portuguese. Applications for the program are open to Portuguese-speaking applicants only. The application fee for the program is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission. The tuition fee for the program is €4,100 for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country. The tuition fee for the program is €4,900 for applicants with nationalities outside the European Union. A €100 discount will be applied to the tuition fees for applications submitted by June 18th, 2025. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments. The full tuition fee payment is due between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The first installment payment of the tuition fee, 25% of the total, is due between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The second installment payment of the tuition fee, 25% of the total, is due between April 25th and April 30th, 2026. The third installment payment of the tuition fee, 25% of the total, is due between September 25th and September 30th, 2026. The fourth installment payment of the tuition fee, 25% of the total, is due between November 25th and November 30th, 2026. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee within approximately one week after the admission announcement. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the program's tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for applicants with nationality from a European Union member country is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for applicants with nationalities outside the European Union is €2,500 unless provided by an official entity. Students must pay €35 for an enrollment fee upon registration. The enrollment fee is updated annually. Applicants must use NOVA IMS' Applications Portal to apply. To apply, applicants must fill out the form available in the user area, including personal, academic, and professional background. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants may attach additional documents, such as certificates of degree completion, but these are optional. If admitted, applicants must submit certificates of degree completion or attendance within one month. Applicants must choose the program they are applying to in the application form. Applicants must present their goals and motivations for applying to the program (limited to 1,000 characters, including spaces). Applicants must pay the application fee to complete the application process. Applicants will receive an email confirming the submitted application after payment of the application fee. The selection process is based on an analysis of applicants' academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions Jury Panel may hold interviews with all or some applicants during the selection process. Interviews for the selection process may be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. The program aims to help students analyze risks, threats, and opportunities in today's BANI world (Brittle, Anxious, Nonlinear, and Incomprehensible). The program aims to help students demonstrate knowledge of intelligence and information gathering techniques. The program addresses challenges posed by cybersecurity, counterintelligence, and Artificial Intelligence.

chunks_for_embedding.title: Educational Financial Policies & Discounts
chunks_for_embedding.summary: This chunk contains information about financial policies in education, including annual school insurance fees, various tuition fee discounts for students, alumni, corporate groups, professional organization members, and ministry employees, along with the specific terms, cumulative conditions, and restrictions on combining these discounts.
chunks_for_embedding.content: Students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance upon registration. The annual school insurance fee is updated annually. Students who pay the tuition fee in a single payment receive a 2.5% discount. NOVA IMS alumni who have completed a bachelor's, postgraduate, master's, or doctoral degree at NOVA IMS receive a 20% discount on the tuition fee. The alumni discount is cumulative with the financial discount for single tuition fee payments. Companies financing at least two employees in the same academic year for the program receive a 10% tuition fee discount. The corporate discount for two employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Companies financing three or more employees in the same academic year for the program receive a 20% tuition fee discount. The corporate discount for three or more employees is not cumulative with other discounts. Members of the Ordem dos Engenheiros – Região Sul receive a 15% discount on tuition fees. The 15% Ordem dos Engenheiros discount can be extended to members' spouses and descendants upon valid documentation. The Ordem dos Engenheiros discount is not cumulative with other financial discounts. Employees of specific ministries receive a 15% tuition fee discount. The ministries eligible for the tuition fee discount are the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Ministry of National Defense, the Ministry of Economy, the Ministry of Finance, and the Ministry of Justice. The 15% discount for employees of ministries is not cumulative with other discounts.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence aims to train experts and managers able to lead and guide the collection, compilation, analysis, and dissemination of marketing information in organizations. The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence provides a balanced curriculum with two components. One component of the curriculum is based on tools and methodologies of marketing management. The other component of the curriculum is supported by methodologies and techniques of information analysis and management. The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence gives access to the Master Degree program in Data-Driven Marketing. The specialization in the Master Degree program is Marketing Intelligence. The Master Degree program is offered in working hours or after working hour formats. The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence is ranked the best Program in Retail Sales Management & Business Development in Portugal. The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence is ranked the 4th best in the World by Eduniversal. Eduniversal is an international agency that publishes an annual ranking of the best MBA and Master degree programs in the world. Applications for the Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The goal of the Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence is to develop strategies, methods, and instruments of marketing management. The program aims to create awareness of client behavior. The program aims to create relationship policies. The program aims to master the processes and tools used for the storage, organization, and access to information for marketing in organizations. The program aims to use several methodologies and tools of exploration and analysis to reduce levels of uncertainty related to solving marketing problems. Paulo Rita is the program coordinator of the Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence. The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence lasts 2 semesters. Classes for the program start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. Classes will run after working hours, after 6:30 p.m., 2 to 3 times a week. The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS is looking for excellent students who have the potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions' Jury Panel values maturity, determination, and motivation in academic and professional careers. The application phase for the Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence is from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. Applicants to the Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field, completed by September 2025. Applicants to the Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence must be proficient in English, spoken and written. To apply, applicants must access the NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. The tuition fee for the Postgraduate Program in Marketing Intelligence is €4,900 for applicants of other nationalities.
Paulo Rita is a Full Professor. Paulo Rita's email address is prita@novaims.unl.pt.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Research and CRM fills a gap in the high-level training of managers, technical staff, and other marketing professionals. The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Research and CRM highlights technical staff and market researchers. The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Research and CRM highlights professionals involved in customer relationship management. The main goal of the Postgraduate Program in Marketing Research and CRM is to provide excellent and balanced training. The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Research and CRM incorporates a conceptual component in marketing methodology with quantitative aptitude. The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Research and CRM includes practical training that draws on case studies and project development. The Postgraduate Program in Marketing Research and CRM gives access to the Master's Degree Program in Data-Driven Marketing with a specialization in Marketing Research and CRM. Applications for the Postgraduate Program in Marketing Research and CRM are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. chunks: The Postgraduate program in Risk Management prepares professionals and executives to address challenges of identifying, assessing, and managing risk in the financial sector. The program is aligned with leading international standards such as those set by the CFA Institute and GARP. The program covers essential knowledge needed for informed decision-making. The program is in line with best practices and regulatory requirements such as Basel III/IV and Solvency II. The program includes a current and innovative curriculum. The program takes a hands-on, practice-oriented approach. The program is supported by a strong analytical foundation. The program integrates cutting-edge techniques in machine learning, deep learning, and artificial intelligence. The program explores the ongoing transformation of the financial industry driven by technologies like blockchain and AI. The program examines the impact of technologies across FinTech, InsurTech, RegTech, Decentralized Finance, and Crypto-assets. The program evolved from the Postgraduate Program in Risk Analysis and Management. The program gives access to the Master Degree Program in Risk Management. The Master Degree Program in Risk Management was formerly the Master's Degree in Statistics and Information Management with a specialisation in Risk Analysis and Management. The Master's Degree with a specialization in Risk Analysis and Management was classified as the best Master's Degree in Risk Management in Portugal by Eduniversal. The Master's Degree with a specialization in Risk Analysis and Management was classified as the 2nd best Master's Degree in Risk Management in the world by Eduniversal. The program's goal is to enable students to become familiar with operations and products that are part of the activity of financial institutions. The program's goal is to enable students to identify and quantify risks associated with financial institutions. The program's goal is to enable students to manage various current risks in institutions. The program's goal is to enable students to make decisions based on quantifying techniques of economic value. The program's goal is to enable students to manage the new European solvency systems for banking and insurance in a balanced way.
Eduniversal is an international agency that publishes the annual ranking of the best Master's Degrees and MBAs in the world. The fourth installment (25%) is due between April 25th and 30th, 2026.

Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Applications for the program are open from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. The application fee for the program is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission in the program. The pre-registration fee is deductible in the program's tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee is €1,250 for applicants with a nationality from a European Union member country. The pre-registration fee is €2,500 for applicants of other nationalities unless provided by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay an enrollment fee of €35 (value updated annually). Upon registration, students must pay an annual school insurance fee of €1.40 (value updated annually). The tuition fee for the program is €4,200 for applicants with EU nationality. The tuition fee for the program is €4,900 for applicants of other nationalities. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments. Full payment of tuition fees is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025. If paid in four installments, the first installment (25%) is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025. The second installment (25%) is due between November 25th and 30th, 2025. The third installment (25%) is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026.
Jorge Miguel Bravo is the Program Coordinator. Jorge Miguel Bravo is an Associate Professor.
Jorge Miguel Bravo's email is jbravo@novaims.unl.pt.

The program lasts for 2 semesters. The classes for the program will start in September 2025 and end in June 2026. The program's classes will run after working hours, starting after 6:30 p.m., 2 to 3 times a week.

The Admissions' Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students with potential to become good technical staff and excellent managers. The Admissions' Jury Panel values attributes such as maturity, determination, and motivation in the academic and professional path. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025 to enter the program. Applicants must be proficient in English (spoken and written) to enter the program. To apply, applicants must access the NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants must fill in the form available in the user area with personal, academic, and professional background information. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae (mandatory document for the application) to apply. Applicants may optionally upload other documents they consider relevant to enrich their application. Applicants will need to submit their bachelor's and/or master's degree completion certificate within one month if admitted. Applicants may include a certificate of degree attendance if they have not yet completed their degree. Applicants must choose the program when applying. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program (limit 1,000 characters, including spaces). Applicants must pay the application fee to finalize their application. After submitting an application, applicants will receive an email confirming their submission. The selection process involves analyzing the academic and professional curriculum of applicants. The Admissions' Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with all or some applicants. Interviews can be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference. After admission and confirmation of enrollment, applicants must pay a pre-registration fee.

Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025 to enter the program.
Applicants must be proficient in English (spoken and written) to enter the program.
To apply, applicants must access the NOVA IMS' Applications Portal.
Applicants must fill in the form available in the user area with personal, academic, and professional background information.
Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae (mandatory document for the application) to apply.
Applicants may optionally upload other documents they consider relevant to enrich their application.
Applicants will need to submit their bachelor's and/or master's degree completion certificate within one month if admitted.
Applicants may include a certificate of degree attendance if they have not yet completed their degree.
Applicants must choose the program when applying.
Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program (limit 1,000 characters, including spaces).
Applicants must pay the application fee to finalize their application.
After submitting an application, applicants will receive an email confirming their submission.
The selection process involves analyzing the academic and professional curriculum of applicants.
The Admissions' Jury Panel may decide to hold interviews with all or some applicants.
Interviews can be conducted face-to-face or via videoconference.
After admission and confirmation of enrollment, applicants must pay a pre-registration fee.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Statistical Systems specializes in Central Bank Statistics. The Postgraduate Program in Statistical Systems was developed in close collaboration with Banco de Portugal. The program aims to provide managers and technical staff working in central bank statistics with fundamental knowledge and skills. The program addresses managers and technical staff working as producers, analysts, or users of statistical information. The Postgraduate Program in Statistical Systems is accredited by the European Statistical System (ESS) with the EMOS (European Master of Official Statistics) seal. The accreditation is recognized by the European Central Bank. The accreditation is recognized by the Irving Fisher Committee on Central Banks’ Statistics. The program places special emphasis on the collection and compilation of monetary statistics. The program places special emphasis on the collection and compilation of financial statistics. The program places special emphasis on the collection and compilation of foreign exchange statistics. The program places special emphasis on the collection and compilation of balance of payments statistics. The statistics involve data arising from the participation of Banco de Portugal in the European System of Central Banks (ESCB). The Postgraduate Program in Statistical Systems lasts 2 semesters. Students may attend the program part-time and complete it within 2 academic years. The classes are held in the classroom or through videoconference. Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. Classes for the program start in September 2025. Classes for the program end in June 2026. Classes run after 4:30 p.m. Classes are held 2 to 3 times a week. The program aims to manage and lead the process of statistical production in central banks. The program aims to develop techniques and methodologies of data collection. The program aims to master tools and processes for storage, organization, and access to information in entities responsible for central bank statistics. The program aims to apply statistical and computational methodologies to produce official statistics. The program aims to produce official statistics that can add value to decision making. The program aims to communicate results in written or oral forms, adapting them to the audience's interests and level. NOVA IMS' Program Coordinator for the postgraduate program is Pedro Simões Coelho.
Pedro Simões Coelho holds the title of Full Professor. Pedro Simões Coelho's email address is psc@novaims.unl.pt.

The Admissions’ Jury Panel of NOVA IMS seeks excellent students for the program. The Admissions’ Jury Panel values maturity in applicants. The Admissions’ Jury Panel values determination in applicants. The Admissions’ Jury Panel values motivation in applicants’ academic and professional careers. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025 to apply. Applicants must be proficient in English (spoken and written) to apply. The selection process is based on the analysis of academic and professional curriculum. The Admissions’ Jury Panel may hold interviews with all or some applicants. Interviews may be conducted face-to-face or by videoconference.

The application phase for the program runs from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. Applications must be submitted through NOVA IMS' Applications Portal. Applicants must fill in a form detailing their personal, academic, and professional background. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae as a mandatory document. Applicants can upload other documents to enrich their application, such as certificates of completion of degrees. Admitted applicants must submit a bachelor's and/or master's degree completion certificate within one month of admission. Applicants must select the program of interest during application. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program in up to 1,000 characters including spaces. Applicants must pay an application fee to complete their submission. After submitting an application, applicants receive a confirmation email. The application fee is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. Applicants with nationality from EU member countries must pay a €1,250 pre-registration fee. Applicants of other nationalities must pay a €2,500 pre-registration fee unless their registration fee is covered by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay a €35 enrollment fee. The enrollment fee is updated annually. Upon registration, students must pay €1.40 for annual school insurance.

The school insurance fee is updated annually. The tuition fee for the Postgraduate Program is €4,900. The fee for each individual course unit in the program is €750. The full payment deadline for tuition is between September 25th and 30th, 2025. The tuition fee can be paid in four installments. The first installment of tuition (25%) is due between September 25th and 30th, 2025. The second installment of tuition (25%) is due between November 25th and 30th, 2025. The third installment of tuition (25%) is due between February 22nd and 28th, 2026. The fourth installment of tuition (25%) is due between April 25th and 30th, 2026.
NOVA IMS programs combine theory with innovative teaching practices.
Scholarship and award opportunities are available for NOVA IMS programs. Details about scholarships and awards can be found at the relevant webpage.

chunks: The Postgraduate Program in Statistical Systems has a specialization in Official Statistics. The Postgraduate Program in Statistical Systems is accredited by the European Statistical System (ESS) with the EMOS (European Master of Official Statistics) seal. The Postgraduate Program offers specialized training in official statistics. The training focuses on the production of statistics covering the statistical activity of National Statistical Systems (NSS). The training covers statistical activities of international organizations of which Portugal is a member. The program aims to provide knowledge and skills crucial to the exercise of activities related to NSS. The program targets technical staff and managers working in National Statistical Systems. These individuals may work as producers, analysts, or users of statistical information in National Statistical Systems. The Postgraduate Program lasts for 2 semesters. Students may attend the program in part-time mode. Part-time students can complete the program within a stipulated period of 2 academic years. The classes are held in the classroom or through videoconference. Applications for the program are open between May 19th and June 18th, 2025. The program manages and leads the process of producing official statistics. The program develops techniques and methodologies for data collection. The program teaches tools and processes used for the storage, organization, and access to information in entities responsible for compiling statistics. The program applies statistical and computational methodologies to produce official statistics. The program includes the use of exploration and information analysis tools to support decision-making. The program focuses on communicating results in written or oral form. The communication of results is adapted to the level and specific interests of the audience. Pedro Simões Coelho is the Program Coordinator of NOVA IMS' Postgraduate Program. The program lasts 2 semesters starting in September 2025 and ending in June 2026. Classes for the program occur after working hours (4:30 p.m.), 2 to 3 times a week. The application phase is from May 19th to June 18th, 2025. Applications can be made through NOVA IMS' Applications Portal.
Pedro Simões Coelho holds the title of Full Professor. Pedro Simões Coelho's email is psc@novaims.unl.pt.

The NOVA IMS Admissions' Jury Panel seeks excellent students for the program. The Jury Panel looks for attributes such as maturity, determination, and motivation in the academic and professional paths of applicants. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree in a compatible field completed by September 2025. Applicants must be proficient in English (spoken and written). Applicants must fill in the application form with their personal, academic, and professional background. Applicants must upload their Curriculum Vitae. The Curriculum Vitae is the only mandatory document for the application. Applicants may optionally upload additional documents they consider relevant, such as certificates of their Bachelor's and/or Master's degree. Admitted applicants must submit their Bachelor's and/or Master's degree completion certificate within one month of admission. Applicants must choose the program on the application portal. Applicants must present their goals and motivation for applying to the program within a 1,000-character limit. Applicants must pay the application fee to finalize the application. The application fee is €51. The application fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal or non-admission to the program. The selection process is based on an analysis of the applicant's academic and professional curriculum. Members of the Admissions' Jury Panel may conduct interviews with applicants. Interviews can be held face-to-face or through videoconference. Admitted applicants must pay a pre-registration fee upon confirmation of enrollment. The pre-registration fee is deductible from the tuition fee. The pre-registration fee is non-refundable in case of withdrawal. The pre-registration fee for applicants from EU member countries is €1,250. The pre-registration fee for applicants from non-EU countries is €2,500 unless covered by an official entity. Upon registration, students must pay an enrollment fee of €35. The enrollment fee is updated annually. Students must pay an annual school insurance fee of €1.40.

The school insurance fee is updated annually. The tuition fee for the Postgraduate Program is €4,900. The tuition fee for each individual course unit is €750. The tuition fee can be paid in full or in four installments. Full tuition fee payment is due between September 25th and September 30th, 2025. The first installment of the tuition fee (25%) is due between September 25th and September 30th, 2025. The second installment of the tuition fee (25%) is due between November 25th and November 30th, 2025. The third installment of the tuition fee (25%) is due between February 22nd and February 28th, 2026. The fourth installment of the tuition fee (25%) is due between April 25th and April 30th, 2026.
